00302 /* global FS configuration variables */
00303 
00304 static pthread_mutex_t mutex_log = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00305 
00306 static desc_log_stream_t  voie;
00307 static int log_level = -1;
00308 static log_t log_desc = LOG_INITIALIZER;
00309 
00310 static int is_loaded = FALSE; /* filsystem initialization status */
00311 
00312 /* thread specific configuration variables */
00313 
00314 typedef struct cmdfsal_thr_info__
00315 {
00316   int is_thread_ok;           /* per thread initialization status */
00317   fsal_handle_t current_dir ; /* current directory handle*/
00318   char current_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN]; /* current path */
00319 
00320   /* thread's context */
00321   fsal_op_context_t     context;
00322   
00323   /* export context : on for each thread,
00324    * on order to make it possible for them
00325    * to access different filesets.
00326    */
00327   fsal_export_context_t exp_context;
00328   int opened;                 /* is file opened ? */
00329   fsal_file_t current_fd;     /* current file descriptor */
00330   
00331 } cmdfsal_thr_info_t;
00332 
00333 /* pthread key to manage thread specific configuration */
00334 
00335 static pthread_key_t  thread_key ;
00336 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00337 
00338 
00339 /* init pthtread_key for current thread */
00340 
00341 static void init_keys( void )
00342 {
00343   if( pthread_key_create( &thread_key, NULL ) == -1 )
00344     printf( "Error %d creating pthread key for thread %p : %s\n",
00345         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00346   
00347   return ;
00348 } /* init_keys */
00349 
00350 
00355 cmdfsal_thr_info_t  * GetFSALCmdContext(){
00356   
00357   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * p_current_thread_vars ;
00358   
00359   
00360   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00361   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00362     printf( "Error %d calling pthread_once for thread %p : %s\n",
00363         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00364     return NULL;
00365   }
00366   
00367   p_current_thread_vars = (cmdfsal_thr_info_t *)pthread_getspecific( thread_key );
00368   
00369   /* we allocate the thread context if this is the first time */
00370   if (p_current_thread_vars==NULL){
00371       
00372     /* allocates thread structure */
00373     p_current_thread_vars = (cmdfsal_thr_info_t *)Mem_Alloc(sizeof(cmdfsal_thr_info_t));
00374     
00375     /* panic !!! */
00376     if (p_current_thread_vars == NULL) {
00377       printf( "%p:commands_FSAL: Not enough memory\n",(caddr_t)pthread_self());
00378       return NULL;
00379     }
00380     
00381     /* Clean thread context */
00382         
00383     memset(  p_current_thread_vars, 0, sizeof( cmdfsal_thr_info_t ) );
00384     
00385     p_current_thread_vars->is_thread_ok = FALSE;
00386     strcpy( p_current_thread_vars->current_path, "");
00387     p_current_thread_vars->opened = FALSE;    
00388   
00389     /* set the specific value */
00390     pthread_setspecific( thread_key , (void *)p_current_thread_vars ) ;
00391     
00392   }
00393  
00394   return p_current_thread_vars ;
00395   
00396 }/* GetFSALCmdContext */

00398 
00402 int Init_Thread_Context( FILE * output,
00403                          cmdfsal_thr_info_t  * context,
00404                          int flag_v )
00405 {
00406   
00407   uid_t  uid;
00408   fsal_status_t st;
00409   fsal_handle_t     hdl_dir;
00410   char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
00411   struct passwd * pw_struct;
00412   
00413   /* for the moment, create export context for root fileset */
00414   st = FSAL_BuildExportContext( &context->exp_context,NULL, NULL );
00415   
00416   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00417   {    
00418     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_BuildExportContext:");
00419     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00420     fprintf(output,"\n");
00421     return st.major;    
00422   }
00423   
00424   /* get user's credentials */
00425   
00426   st = FSAL_InitClientContext( &context->context );
00427 
00428   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00429   {    
00430     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_InitClientContext:");
00431     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00432     fprintf(output,"\n");
00433     return st.major;    
00434   }
00435 
00436   uid = getuid();
00437   pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
00438   
00439   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
00440   {
00441     fprintf( output, "Unknown uid %u\n", uid );
00442     return errno;
00443   }
00444   
00445   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &context->context, &context->exp_context,
00446                               uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, NULL , 0 );
00447   
00448   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00449   {
00450     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_GetUserCred:");
00451     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00452     fprintf(output,"\n");
00453     return st.major;    
00454   }  
00455   
00456   /* get root file handle */
00457   
00458   /* lookup */
00459   
00460   st = FSAL_lookup( NULL, NULL, &context->context, &hdl_dir, NULL );
00461   
00462   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
00463     
00464     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_lookup:");
00465     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00466     fprintf(output,"\n");
00467     return st.major;
00468     
00469   }
00470   
00471   /* save root handle */
00472   
00473   context->current_dir = hdl_dir;
00474   context->is_thread_ok = TRUE;
00475       
00476   strcpy(context->current_path,"/");
00477   
00478   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&context->current_dir);  
00479   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Current directory is \"%s\" (@%s)\n",
00480     context->current_path,buff);
00481   
00482   return 0;
00483     
00484 }

00486 
00487 void fsal_layer_SetLogLevel(int log_lvl  ){
00488   
00489   log_stream_t * curr;
00490   
00491   /* mutex pour proteger le descriptor de log */
00492   pthread_mutex_lock( &mutex_log );
00493       
00494   /* first time */
00495   if ( log_level == -1){
00496     log_level = log_lvl;
00497     voie.fd = fileno( stderr ) ;
00498     AddLogStreamJd( &log_desc, V_FD,voie,log_level,SUP);
00499   } else {
00500     log_level = log_lvl;
00501     /* changing log level */
00502     curr = log_desc.liste_voies;
00503     while (curr){
00504       curr->niveau = log_level;
00505       curr = curr->suivante;
00506     }
00507   }
00508   
00509   pthread_mutex_unlock( &mutex_log );
00510       
00511 }

00514 static void getopt_init(){
00515    Opterr = 0; /* disables Getopt error message */
00516    /* reinits Getopt processing */
00517    Optind = 1;
00518 }

00520 
00521 int fsal_init(char * filename,
00522               int flag_v,
00523               FILE * output
00524     )
00525 {
00526   config_file_t config_file;
00527   
00528   /* FSAL init parameters */
00529   fsal_parameter_t  init_param;  
00530   fsal_status_t     st;
00531   
00532   /* thread context */
00533   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
00534   
00535   /* Initializes the FSAL */
00536 
00537   /* use FSAL error family. */
00538   
00539   AddFamilyError( ERR_FSAL, "FSAL related Errors", tab_errstatus_FSAL ) ;  
00540   AddFamilyError( ERR_POSIX, "POSIX Errors", tab_systeme_status ) ;  
00541 
00542     
00543   /* set configuration defaults */
00544   
00545   FSAL_SetDefault_FSAL_parameter( &init_param );
00546   FSAL_SetDefault_FS_common_parameter( &init_param );
00547   FSAL_SetDefault_FS_specific_parameter( &init_param );
00548 
00549     
00550   /* Parse config file */
00551       
00552   config_file = config_ParseFile( filename );
00553   
00554   if ( !config_file ){
00555     fprintf(output, "init_fs: Error parsing %s: %s\n", filename,  config_GetErrorMsg());
00556     return -1;
00557   }
00558     
00559   
00560   /* Load FSAL configuration from file configuration */
00561 
00562   st = FSAL_load_FSAL_parameter_from_conf( config_file,&init_param );
00563   
00564   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00565   {
00566     if ( st.major == ERR_FSAL_NOENT )
00567     {
00568       fprintf(output,"Missing FSAL stanza in config file\n");
00569     }
00570     else
00571     {
00572       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_load_FSAL_parameter_from_conf:");
00573       print_fsal_status(output,st);
00574       fprintf(output,"\n");
00575       return st.major;
00576     }
00577   }
00578   
00579   st = FSAL_load_FS_common_parameter_from_conf( config_file,&init_param );
00580   
00581   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00582   {
00583     if ( st.major == ERR_FSAL_NOENT )
00584     {
00585       fprintf(output,"Missing FS common stanza in config file\n");
00586     }
00587     else
00588     {
00589       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_load_FS_common_parameter_from_conf:");
00590       print_fsal_status(output,st);
00591       fprintf(output,"\n");
00592       return st.major;
00593     }
00594   }
00595   
00596   st = FSAL_load_FS_specific_parameter_from_conf( config_file,&init_param );
00597   
00598   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00599   {
00600     if ( st.major == ERR_FSAL_NOENT )
00601     {
00602       fprintf(output,"Missing FS specific stanza in config file\n");
00603     }
00604     else
00605     {
00606       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_load_FS_specific_parameter_from_conf:");
00607       print_fsal_status(output,st);
00608       fprintf(output,"\n");
00609       return st.major;
00610     }
00611   }    
00612     
00613   /* Free config struct */  
00614   config_Free( config_file );    
00615   
00616     
00617   /* overide log descriptor for FSAL */
00618   
00619   init_param.fsal_info.log_outputs = log_desc;
00620   
00621   /* Initialization */
00622   
00623   if (flag_v)
00624     fprintf(output,"Filesystem initialization...\n");
00625   
00626   st = FSAL_Init( &init_param );
00627   
00628   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) ){
00629     
00630     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_Init:");
00631     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00632     fprintf(output,"\n");
00633     return st.major;
00634     
00635   }
00636   
00637   is_loaded = TRUE; 
00638   
00639   /* initialize current thread */
00640   
00641   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
00642   
00643   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
00644   { 
00645     int rc;
00646     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, flag_v );
00647     if (rc != 0) return rc;
00648   }
00649   
00650   return 0;
00651 }
00652 
00654 int fn_fsal_init_fs( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00655              char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00656              FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
00657 {
00658   int rc;
00659 
00660   static char format[]="hv";
00661   
00662   static char help_init[]=
00663     "usage: init_fs [options] <ganesha_config_file>\n"
00664     "options :\n"
00665     "\t-h print this help\n"
00666     "\t-v verbose mode\n";
00667         
00668   int option;
00669   int flag_v = 0;
00670   int flag_h = 0;  
00671   int err_flag = 0;
00672   char * filename = NULL;
00673   
00674   
00675   /* analysing options */
00676   getopt_init();
00677   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
00678     switch(option){
00679       case 'v':
00680         if (flag_v)
00681           fprintf(output,
00682               "init_fs: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
00683         else flag_v++;
00684         break;
00685       case 'h':
00686         if ( flag_h )
00687           fprintf(output,
00688               "init_fs: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
00689         else flag_h++;
00690         break;
00691       case '?':
00692         fprintf(output,"init_fs: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
00693         err_flag ++;
00694         break;
00695     }    
00696   }
00697   
00698   if (flag_h){
00699     fprintf(output,help_init);
00700     return 0;
00701   }
00702   
00703   /* verifies mandatory argument */
00704   
00705   if ( Optind != (argc-1) ){
00706     /* too much or not enough arguments */
00707     err_flag ++;
00708   } else {
00709     filename = argv[Optind];
00710   }
00711   
00712   if (err_flag){
00713     fprintf(output,help_init);
00714     return -1;
00715   }
00716 
00717   rc = fsal_init(filename, flag_v, output);
00718 
00719   return rc;
00720 }
00721

00723 
00726 int fn_fsal_pwd( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00727         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00728         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00729       ){
00730 
00731   
00732   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
00733 
00734   /* is the fs initialized ? */
00735   if (!is_loaded){
00736     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
00737     return -1;
00738   }
00739   
00740   
00741   /* initialize current thread */
00742     
00743   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
00744   
00745   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
00746   { 
00747     int rc;
00748     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
00749     if (rc != 0) return rc;
00750   }
00751 
00752   
00753   
00754   {
00755   char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
00756   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&context->current_dir);
00757   
00758   fprintf(output,"Current directory is \"%s\" (@%s)\n",
00759     context->current_path,buff);
00760 
00761   }
00762 
00763   return 0;
00764     
00765 }

00767 
00768 /* solves a relative or absolute path */
00769 
00770 int solvepath(
00771     char * io_global_path, int size_global_path, /* [IN-OUT] global path     */
00772     char * i_spec_path,                          /* [IN] user specified path */
00773     fsal_handle_t i_current_handle,       /* [IN] current directory handle   */
00774     fsal_handle_t * new_handle,           /* [OUT] target object handle      */
00775     FILE * output )
00776 {
00777   
00778   char str_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00779   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
00780   
00781   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
00782   
00783   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
00784   { 
00785     int rc;
00786     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0);
00787     if (rc != 0) return rc;
00788   }
00789 
00790   
00791   /* local copy */
00792   strncpy(str_path,i_spec_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00793 
00794   
00795   if (str_path[0] == '@')
00796   /* It is a file handle */
00797   {
00798     int rc;
00799     
00800     rc = sscanHandle( new_handle, str_path+1 );
00801     
00802     if ( rc<=0 ){
00803       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
00804       return -1;
00805     }
00806     
00807     if ( str_path[rc+1] != '\0' )
00808     {
00809       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
00810       return -1;
00811     }
00812     
00813     strncpy( io_global_path, str_path ,size_global_path);
00814     
00815     return 0;        
00816     
00817   }
00818   else if (str_path[0] == '/')
00819   /* absolute path, proceed a lookupPath */
00820   {
00821     fsal_path_t path;
00822     fsal_status_t st;
00823     fsal_handle_t tmp_hdl;  
00824     
00825     
00826     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_str2path(str_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,&path))){
00827       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2path:");
00828       print_fsal_status(output,st);
00829       fprintf(output,"\n");
00830       return st.major;
00831     }
00832     
00833     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st=FSAL_lookupPath(&path,&context->context,&tmp_hdl,NULL))){
00834       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_lookupPath:");
00835       print_fsal_status(output,st);
00836       fprintf(output,"\n");
00837       return st.major;
00838     }
00839     
00840     /* cleans path */
00841     clean_path(str_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00842 
00843     strncpy(io_global_path,str_path,size_global_path);
00844     *new_handle = tmp_hdl;
00845     
00846     return 0;
00847         
00848   }
00849   else
00850   /* relative path, proceed a step by step lookup */
00851   {
00852     fsal_name_t name;
00853     fsal_status_t st;
00854     fsal_handle_t old_hdl = i_current_handle;
00855     fsal_handle_t tmp_hdl;
00856     char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00857     char * next_name = str_path;
00858     char * curr = str_path;
00859     int last=0;
00860     
00861     tmp_path[0]='\0'; /* empty string */
00862     
00863     do {
00864       
00865       /* tokenize to the next '/' */         
00866       while( (*curr!='\0') && (*curr!='/') )
00867         curr++;
00868 
00869       if (!(*curr)) last=1; /* remembers if it was the last dir */
00870       *curr='\0';
00871             
00872       /* build the name */
00873       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_str2name(next_name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,&name))){
00874         fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
00875         print_fsal_status(output,st);
00876         fprintf(output,"\n");
00877         return st.major;
00878       }
00879 
00880       /* lookup this name */
00881       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_lookup(&old_hdl,&name,&context->context,&tmp_hdl,NULL))){
00882         fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_lookup:");
00883         print_fsal_status(output,st);
00884         fprintf(output,"\n");
00885         return st.major;
00886       }
00887       
00888       /* if handles are the same, we are at fileset root,
00889        * so, don't modify the path.
00890        * Else, we contatenate them.
00891        */
00892       if ( FSAL_handlecmp( &old_hdl, &tmp_hdl, &st ) != 0 )
00893       {
00894         /* updates current handle */
00895         old_hdl = tmp_hdl;
00896 
00897         /* adds /name at the end of the path */
00898         strncat(tmp_path,"/",FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00899         strncat(tmp_path,next_name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00900       }
00901       
00902       /* updates cursors */
00903       if (!last){
00904         curr ++;
00905         next_name = curr ;
00906         /* ignore successive slashes */
00907         while((*curr!='\0') && (*curr=='/')){
00908           curr++;
00909           next_name = curr;
00910         }
00911         if (!(*curr)) last=1; /* it is the last dir */
00912       }
00913       
00914     } while(!last);
00915     
00916     /* everything is OK, apply changes */
00917     
00918     strncat(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);   
00919     clean_path(io_global_path,size_global_path);
00920     
00921     *new_handle = old_hdl;
00922     
00923     return 0;
00924       
00925   }
00926   
00927   
00928 }
00929 
00930 
00932 int fn_fsal_cd( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00933         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00934         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
00935       ){
00936 
00937   
00938   static char help_cd[]=
00939   "usage: cd <path>\n";
00940 
00941   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00942   fsal_handle_t new_hdl;
00943   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
00944   fsal_status_t st;
00945   int rc;
00946     
00947   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
00948 
00949   /* is the fs initialized ? */
00950   if (!is_loaded){
00951     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
00952     return -1;
00953   }
00954   
00955   
00956   /* initialize current thread */
00957     
00958   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
00959   
00960   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
00961   { 
00962     int rc;
00963     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
00964     if (rc != 0) return rc;
00965   }
00966   
00967   /* Exactly one arg expected */
00968   if (argc!=2){
00969     fprintf(output,help_cd);
00970     return -1;
00971   }
00972   
00973   /* is it a relative or absolute path. */
00974   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00975   
00976   if (rc = 
00977       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
00978                 argv[1],context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
00979     return rc;
00980 
00981   /* verify if the object is a directory */
00982   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes );
00983   FSAL_SET_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes,
00984       FSAL_ATTR_TYPE
00985       | FSAL_ATTR_MODE
00986       | FSAL_ATTR_GROUP
00987       | FSAL_ATTR_OWNER
00988       );
00989   
00990  
00991   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_getattrs(&new_hdl,&context->context,&attrs))){
00992     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
00993     print_fsal_status(output,st);
00994     fprintf(output,"\n");
00995     return st.major;
00996   }
00997   
00998   if (attrs.type != FSAL_TYPE_DIR){
00999     fprintf(output,"Error: %s is not a directory\n",glob_path);  
01000     return ENOTDIR;
01001   }
01002   
01003   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_test_access(&context->context,FSAL_X_OK,&attrs))){
01004     fprintf(output,"Error: %s: permission denied.\n",glob_path);
01005     return st.major;
01006   }
01007 
01008 /*  if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_access(&new_hdl,&contexte,FSAL_X_OK,&attrs))){
01009     fprintf(output,"Error: %s: permission denied.\n",);
01010     return st.major;
01011   }*/
01012   
01013   
01014   /* if so, apply changes */  
01015   strncpy(context->current_path,glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);   
01016   context->current_dir = new_hdl;
01017     
01018   {
01019   char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
01020   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&context->current_dir);
01021   
01022   fprintf(output,"Current directory is \"%s\" (@%s)\n",
01023     context->current_path,buff);
01024   }
01025    
01026   return 0;
01027       
01028 }
01029 
01030 
01032 int fn_fsal_stat( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01033         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01034         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01035       ){
01036   
01037   
01038   static char format[]="hv";
01039    
01040   static char help_stat[]=
01041   "usage: stat [-h][-v] <file>\n";
01042 
01043   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01044   fsal_handle_t new_hdl;
01045   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
01046   fsal_status_t st;
01047   int rc,option;
01048   int flag_v=0;
01049   int flag_h=0;
01050   int err_flag=0;
01051   char * file = NULL;
01052     
01053   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01054 
01055   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01056   if (!is_loaded){
01057     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01058     return -1;
01059   }
01060   
01061   
01062   /* initialize current thread */
01063     
01064   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
01065   
01066   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
01067   { 
01068     int rc;
01069     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
01070     if (rc != 0) return rc;
01071   }
01072   
01073   /* analysing options */
01074   getopt_init();
01075   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
01076     switch(option){
01077       case 'v':
01078         if (flag_v)
01079           fprintf(output,
01080               "stat: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01081         else flag_v++;
01082         break;
01083       case 'h':
01084         if ( flag_h )
01085           fprintf(output,
01086               "stat: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01087         else flag_h++;
01088         break;
01089       case '?':
01090         fprintf(output,"stat: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01091         err_flag ++;
01092         break;
01093     }    
01094   }
01095   
01096   if (flag_h){
01097     fprintf(output,help_stat);
01098     return 0;
01099   }
01100   
01101   /* Exactly one arg expected */
01102   if (Optind != (argc-1)){
01103     err_flag ++;
01104   } else {
01105     file = argv[Optind];
01106   }
01107   
01108   if (err_flag){
01109     fprintf(output,help_stat);
01110     return -1;
01111   }
01112     
01113   /* copy current path. */
01114   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01115   
01116   /* retrieves object handle*/
01117   if (rc = 
01118       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01119                 file,context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
01120     return rc;
01121 
01122   /* retrieve supported attributes */
01123   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes );
01124   FSAL_SET_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_SUPPATTR );
01125   
01126   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_getattrs(&new_hdl,&context->context,&attrs))){
01127     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
01128     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01129     fprintf(output,"\n");
01130     return st.major;
01131   }
01132   
01133   /* print supported attributes if verbose flag is set */
01134   if (flag_v){
01135     fprintf(output,"Supported attributes :\n");
01136     print_fsal_attrib_mask(attrs.supported_attributes,output);
01137     fprintf(output,"\nAttributes :\n");
01138   }
01139   
01140   /* getting all supported attributes */
01141   attrs.asked_attributes = attrs.supported_attributes;
01142   
01143   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_getattrs(&new_hdl,&context->context,&attrs))){
01144     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
01145     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01146     fprintf(output,"\n");
01147     return st.major;
01148   }  
01149   
01150   /* print file attributes */
01151   print_fsal_attributes( attrs, output);
01152   
01153   return 0;
01154   
01155 }
01156 
01157 
01159 int fn_fsal_lsxattrs( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
01160         char ** argv ,         /* IN : arg list               */
01161         FILE * output          /* IN : output stream          */
01162       )
01163 {
01164   static char format[]="hv";
01165    
01166   static char help_lsxattr[]=
01167   "usage: lsxattrs [-h][-v] <path>\n";
01168 
01169   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01170   fsal_handle_t new_hdl;
01171   fsal_status_t st;
01172   int rc,option;
01173   int flag_v=0;
01174   int flag_h=0;
01175   int err_flag=0;
01176   char * file = NULL;
01177   
01178   unsigned int    cookie;
01179   fsal_xattrent_t xattr_array[256];
01180   unsigned int    nb_returned;
01181   int             eol;
01182     
01183   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01184 
01185   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01186   if (!is_loaded){
01187     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01188     return -1;
01189   }
01190   
01191   
01192   /* initialize current thread */
01193     
01194   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
01195   
01196   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
01197   { 
01198     int rc;
01199     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
01200     if (rc != 0) return rc;
01201   }
01202   
01203   /* analysing options */
01204   getopt_init();
01205   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
01206     switch(option){
01207       case 'v':
01208         if (flag_v)
01209           fprintf(output,
01210               "lsxattrs: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01211         else flag_v++;
01212         break;
01213       case 'h':
01214         if ( flag_h )
01215           fprintf(output,
01216               "lsxattrs: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01217         else flag_h++;
01218         break;
01219       case '?':
01220         fprintf(output,"lsxattrs: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01221         err_flag ++;
01222         break;
01223     }    
01224   }
01225   
01226   if (flag_h){
01227     fprintf(output,help_lsxattr);
01228     return 0;
01229   }
01230   
01231   /* Exactly one arg expected */
01232   if (Optind != (argc-1)){
01233     err_flag ++;
01234   } else {
01235     file = argv[Optind];
01236   }
01237   
01238   if (err_flag){
01239     fprintf(output,help_lsxattr);
01240     return -1;
01241   }
01242     
01243   /* copy current path. */
01244   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01245   
01246   /* retrieves object handle*/
01247   if (rc = 
01248       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01249                 file,context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
01250     return rc;
01251   
01252   /* list extended attributes */
01253   
01254   cookie = XATTRS_READLIST_FROM_BEGINNING;
01255   eol = FALSE;
01256   
01257   while ( !eol )
01258   {
01259     unsigned int index;
01260     
01261     st = FSAL_ListXAttrs( &new_hdl, cookie, &context->context,
01262                           xattr_array, 256, &nb_returned, &eol );
01263     
01264     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st))
01265     {
01266       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_ListXAttrs:");
01267       print_fsal_status(output,st);
01268       fprintf(output,"\n");
01269       return st.major;
01270     }
01271     
01272     /* list attributes */
01273     
01274     for ( index = 0; index < nb_returned; index ++ )
01275     {
01276       if ( flag_v )
01277         /* print all attribute's info */
01278         fprintf(output, "%u: %s\n", xattr_array[index].xattr_id, xattr_array[index].xattr_name.name );
01279       else
01280         /* print only attribute's name */
01281         fprintf(output, "%s\n", xattr_array[index].xattr_name.name );
01282       
01283       cookie = xattr_array[index].xattr_cookie ;
01284     }
01285         
01286   }
01287   
01288   return 0;
01289   
01290 }
01291 
01293 int fn_fsal_getxattr( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
01294         char ** argv ,         /* IN : arg list               */
01295         FILE * output          /* IN : output stream          */
01296       )
01297 {
01298   static char format[]="hvaxn";
01299    
01300   static char help_getxattr[]=
01301   "usage: getxattr [-hv] [-a|-n|-x] <path> <attr_name>\n"
01302     "options :\n"
01303     "\t-h print this help\n"
01304     "\t-v verbose mode\n"  
01305     "\t-a display attribute value as ascii\n"
01306     "\t-n display attribute value as numeric\n"
01307     "\t-x display attribute value as hexa\n";
01308 
01309   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01310   fsal_handle_t new_hdl;
01311   fsal_status_t st;
01312   int rc,option;
01313   int flag_v=0;
01314   int flag_h=0;
01315   int flag_x=0;
01316   int flag_n=0;
01317   int flag_a=0;
01318   int err_flag=0;
01319   char * file = NULL;
01320   char * attrname = NULL;
01321 
01322   fsal_name_t attrnamefsal;
01323   char buffer[4096];
01324   size_t returned;
01325   unsigned int index;
01326             
01327   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01328 
01329   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01330   if (!is_loaded){
01331     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01332     return -1;
01333   }
01334   
01335   
01336   /* initialize current thread */
01337     
01338   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
01339   
01340   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
01341   { 
01342     int rc;
01343     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
01344     if (rc != 0) return rc;
01345   }
01346   
01347   /* analysing options */
01348   getopt_init();
01349   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
01350     switch(option){
01351       case 'v':
01352         if (flag_v)
01353           fprintf(output,
01354               "getxattr: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01355         else flag_v++;
01356         break;
01357       case 'a':
01358         if (flag_a)
01359           fprintf(output,
01360               "getxattr: warning: option 'a' has been specified more than once.\n");
01361         else flag_a++;
01362         break;
01363       case 'x':
01364         if (flag_x)
01365           fprintf(output,
01366               "getxattr: warning: option 'x' has been specified more than once.\n");
01367         else flag_x++;
01368         break;
01369       case 'n':
01370         if (flag_n)
01371           fprintf(output,
01372               "getxattr: warning: option 'n' has been specified more than once.\n");
01373         else flag_n++;
01374         break;
01375       case 'h':
01376         if ( flag_h )
01377           fprintf(output,
01378               "getxattr: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01379         else flag_h++;
01380         break;
01381       case '?':
01382         fprintf(output,"getxattr: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01383         err_flag ++;
01384         break;
01385     }    
01386   }
01387   
01388   if (flag_h){
01389     fprintf(output,help_getxattr);
01390     return 0;
01391   }
01392   
01393   if ( flag_x + flag_n + flag_a > 1 )
01394   {
01395     fprintf(output,"getxattr: options -x, -a and -n are not compatible\n");
01396     fprintf(output,help_getxattr);
01397     return -1;
01398   }
01399   
01400   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
01401   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
01402     err_flag ++;
01403   } else {
01404     file = argv[Optind];
01405     attrname =  argv[Optind+1];
01406   }
01407   
01408   if (err_flag){
01409     fprintf(output,help_getxattr);
01410     return -1;
01411   }
01412     
01413   /* copy current path. */
01414   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01415   
01416   /* retrieves object handle*/
01417   if (rc = 
01418       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01419                 file,context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
01420     return rc;
01421   
01422   /* create fsal_name_t */
01423   FSAL_str2name( attrname, 256, &attrnamefsal );
01424 
01425   memset( buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer) );
01426   
01427   /* get extended attribute */
01428  
01429   st = FSAL_GetXAttrValueByName( &new_hdl, &attrnamefsal, &context->context,
01430                     buffer, 4096, &returned );
01431 
01432   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st))
01433   {
01434     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_GetXAttrValueByName:");
01435     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01436     fprintf(output,"\n");
01437     return st.major;
01438   }
01439 
01440   
01441    if ( returned == 0 )
01442    {
01443      fprintf(output,"(empty)\n");
01444      return 0;
01445    }  
01446     
01447   /* display returned value */
01448   
01449   /* when no flags are given, try to determinate what it is */
01450    
01451   if ( !flag_a && !flag_n && !flag_x )
01452   {
01453     /* is it ascii ? */
01454     if ( strlen(buffer) == returned - 1 || strlen(buffer) == returned )
01455     {
01456       unsigned int i;
01457       char * str = buffer;
01458       int is_ascii = TRUE;
01459       
01460       for ( i = 0; i < strlen(str); i++ )
01461       {
01462           if ( !isprint( str[i] ) && !isspace( str[i] ) )
01463           {
01464             is_ascii = FALSE;
01465             break;
01466           }
01467       }
01468       if ( is_ascii ) flag_a = 1;
01469     }
01470     
01471     /* is it numeric */
01472     if ( !flag_a )
01473     {
01474       if ( returned == 1 || returned == 2 || returned == 4 || returned == 8 )
01475         flag_n = 1;
01476       else
01477         flag_x = 1;
01478     }    
01479   }
01480   
01481   if ( flag_a )
01482   {
01483     if ( strlen(buffer)>0 && buffer[strlen(buffer)-1] != '\n' )
01484       fprintf(output, "%s\n", buffer );
01485     else
01486       fprintf(output, "%s", buffer );
01487   }
01488   else if (flag_n )
01489   {
01490     if ( returned == 1 )
01491       fprintf(output, "%hhu\n", buffer[0] );
01492     else if ( returned == 2 )
01493       fprintf(output, "%hu\n", *((unsigned short*)buffer) );
01494     else if ( returned == 4 )
01495       fprintf(output, "%u\n", *((unsigned int*)buffer) );
01496     else if ( returned == 8 )
01497       fprintf(output, "%llu\n", *((unsigned long long*)buffer) );
01498     else
01499     {
01500       for ( index = 0; index < returned; index += 8 )
01501       {
01502         unsigned long long * p64 = (unsigned long long *)(buffer + index);
01503         if (index == 0 )
01504           fprintf(output, "%llu", *p64 );
01505         else
01506           fprintf(output, ".%llu", *p64 );
01507       }
01508       fprintf(output, "\n");
01509 
01510     }
01511     
01512   }
01513   else if ( flag_x ) /* hexa */
01514   {
01515       fprintf(output, "0X" );
01516       for ( index = 0; index < returned; index ++ )
01517       {
01518         unsigned char val = buffer[index];
01519         fprintf(output, "%hhX", val );
01520       }
01521       fprintf(output, "\n");
01522     
01523   }
01524   
01525   return 0;
01526   
01527 }
01528 
01529 
01530 
01531 
01533 int fn_fsal_ls(
01534         int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01535         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01536         FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */      
01537 {
01538   
01539   static char format[]="hvdlS";
01540   
01541   static char help_ls[]=
01542     "usage: ls [options] [name|path]\n"
01543     "options :\n"
01544     "\t-h print this help\n"
01545     "\t-v verbose mode\n"  
01546     "\t-d print directory info instead of listing its content\n"      
01547     "\t-l print standard UNIX attributes\n"
01548     "\t-S print all supported attributes\n";
01549     
01550   int option;
01551   int flag_v = 0;
01552   int flag_h = 0;
01553   int flag_d = 0;
01554   int flag_l = 0;
01555   int flag_S = 0;
01556   int err_flag = 0;
01557   char * str_name;
01558   
01559   #define READDIR_SIZE FSAL_READDIR_SIZE
01560   
01561   fsal_attrib_mask_t mask_needed;
01562   fsal_handle_t      obj_hdl;
01563   fsal_dir_t dir;
01564   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01565   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
01566   fsal_status_t st;
01567   fsal_cookie_t from,to;
01568   fsal_dirent_t entries[READDIR_SIZE];
01569   fsal_count_t number;
01570   fsal_boolean_t eod = FALSE;
01571   fsal_path_t symlink_path;
01572   int error = FALSE;
01573   int rc;
01574 
01575   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01576         
01577   /* analysing options */
01578   getopt_init();
01579   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){
01580     
01581     switch(option){
01582       case 'v':
01583         if (flag_v)
01584           fprintf(output,
01585               "ls: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01586         else flag_v++;
01587         break;
01588       case 'h':
01589         if ( flag_h )
01590           fprintf(output,
01591               "ls: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01592         else flag_h++;
01593         break;
01594       case 'd':
01595         if ( flag_d )
01596           fprintf(output,
01597               "ls: warning: option 'd' has been specified more than once.\n");
01598         else flag_d++;
01599         break;
01600       case 'l':
01601         if ( flag_l )
01602           fprintf(output,
01603               "ls: warning: option 'l' has been specified more than once.\n");
01604         else flag_l++;
01605         break;
01606       case 'S':
01607         if ( flag_S )
01608           fprintf(output,
01609               "ls: warning: option 'S' has been specified more than once.\n");
01610         else flag_S++;
01611         break;
01612       case '?':
01613         fprintf(output,"ls: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01614         err_flag ++;
01615         break;
01616     }
01617     
01618   }
01619 
01620   if (flag_l+flag_S>1){
01621     fprintf(output,"ls: conflict between options l,S\n");
01622     err_flag++;
01623   }
01624     
01625   if (flag_h){
01626     fprintf(output,help_ls);
01627     return 0;
01628   }
01629   if (err_flag){
01630     fprintf(output,help_ls);
01631     return -1;
01632   }
01633   
01634     
01635   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01636   if (!is_loaded){
01637     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01638     return -1;
01639   }
01640   
01641   
01642   /* initialize current thread */
01643     
01644   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
01645   
01646   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
01647   { 
01648     int rc;
01649     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
01650     if (rc != 0) return rc;
01651   }
01652   
01653   /* prepare needed attributes mask */
01654   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( mask_needed );
01655   FSAL_SET_MASK( mask_needed, FSAL_ATTRS_MANDATORY );
01656   
01657   if (flag_l)
01658     FSAL_SET_MASK( mask_needed, FSAL_ATTRS_POSIX );
01659   else if (flag_S)
01660     mask_needed = 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL;
01661   
01662   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01663   
01664   /* first, retrieve the argument (if any) */
01665   if (Optind == (argc-1)){
01666     str_name = argv[Optind];
01667 
01668     /* retrieving handle */  
01669     if (rc = 
01670         solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01671                   str_name,context->current_dir,&obj_hdl,output))
01672       return rc;
01673     
01674   } else {
01675     str_name = ".";
01676     obj_hdl = context->current_dir;
01677   }  
01678     
01679   if (flag_v)
01680     fprintf(output,"proceeding ls on \"%s\"\n", glob_path);
01681 
01682   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes );
01683   FSAL_SET_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_SUPPATTR );
01684   
01685   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_getattrs(&obj_hdl,&context->context,&attrs))){
01686     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
01687     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01688     fprintf(output,"\n");
01689     return st.major;
01690   }
01691   
01692   /* getting all needed attributes */
01693   attrs.asked_attributes = ( attrs.supported_attributes & mask_needed );
01694   
01695   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_getattrs(&obj_hdl,&context->context,&attrs))){
01696     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
01697     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01698     fprintf(output,"\n");
01699     return st.major;
01700   }
01701 
01702   
01703  /*
01704   * if the object is a file or a directoy with the -d option specified,
01705   * we only show its info and exit.
01706   */  
01707   if ( (attrs.type != FSAL_TYPE_DIR) || flag_d ){
01708    
01709     if ( (attrs.type == FSAL_TYPE_LNK) && (flag_l) ){
01710       
01711       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_readlink(
01712             &obj_hdl,&context->context,&symlink_path,NULL))){
01713         fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_readlink:");
01714         print_fsal_status(output,st);
01715         fprintf(output,"\n");
01716         return st.major;
01717       }
01718       
01719     }
01720    
01721     if (flag_l)      
01722       print_item_line( output,&attrs, str_name, symlink_path.path);
01723     
01724     else if (flag_S){
01725       
01726       char tracebuff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];      
01727       snprintHandle(tracebuff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&obj_hdl);
01728       fprintf(output,"%s (@%s):\n",str_name,tracebuff);
01729       print_fsal_attributes( attrs, output );
01730       
01731     } else  /* only prints the name */
01732       fprintf(output,"%s\n",str_name);
01733           
01734     return 0;
01735   }
01736 
01737   /*
01738    * the current object is a directory, we have to list its element
01739    */
01740   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(
01741         st = FSAL_opendir(&obj_hdl,&context->context,&dir,NULL))){
01742     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_opendir:");
01743     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01744     fprintf(output,"\n");
01745     return st.major;
01746   }
01747 
01748   from = FSAL_READDIR_FROM_BEGINNING;
01749     
01750   while (!error && !eod){
01751     fsal_dirent_t * curr;
01752     char item_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01753    
01754     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(
01755           st = FSAL_readdir(&dir, from,attrs.supported_attributes & mask_needed,
01756                             READDIR_SIZE * sizeof(fsal_dirent_t),
01757                             entries, &to , &number, &eod ))){
01758       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_readdir:");
01759       print_fsal_status(output,st);
01760       fprintf(output,"\n");
01761       error =  st.major;
01762       number = 0;
01763     }
01764 
01765     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"FSAL_readdir returned %u entries\n", (unsigned int)number);
01766     
01767     if (number>0){
01768       curr = entries;
01769       do {
01770         int len;
01771         len = strlen(str_name);
01772         if (!strcmp(str_name,"."))
01773           strncpy(item_path,curr->name.name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01774         else if (str_name[len-1] == '/')
01775           snprintf(item_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,"%s%s",str_name,curr->name.name);
01776         else
01777           snprintf(item_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,"%s/%s",str_name,curr->name.name);
01778         
01779         if ( (curr->attributes.type == FSAL_TYPE_LNK) && (flag_l) ){
01780           
01781           if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_readlink(
01782                 &curr->handle,&context->context,&symlink_path,NULL))){
01783             fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_readlink:");
01784             print_fsal_status(output,st);
01785             fprintf(output,"\n");
01786             return st.major;
01787           }
01788           
01789         }
01790 
01791         if (flag_l)
01792           print_item_line( output,&(curr->attributes),item_path, symlink_path.path);
01793         
01794         else if (flag_S){
01795           
01796           char tracebuff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];      
01797           snprintHandle(tracebuff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&curr->handle);
01798           
01799           fprintf(output,"%s (@%s):\n",item_path,tracebuff);
01800           print_fsal_attributes( curr->attributes, output);
01801           
01802         } else  /* only prints the name */
01803           fprintf(output,"%s\n",item_path);
01804         
01805       } while(curr = curr->nextentry);
01806     }
01807     /* preparing next call */
01808     from = to;
01809     
01810   }
01811   
01812   FSAL_closedir(&dir);
01813        
01814   return error;  
01815   
01816 } /* fn_fsal_ls */
01817   
01818 
01819 
01821 int fn_fsal_callstat( int argc ,/* IN : number of args in argv */
01822         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01823         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01824       ){
01825 
01826   fsal_statistics_t call_stat;
01827   int i;
01828   
01829   static char help_stats[]=
01830   "usage: stats\n";
01831 
01832   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01833   if (!is_loaded){
01834     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01835     return -1;
01836   }
01837   
01838   /* No args expected */
01839   if (argc!=1){
01840     fprintf(output,help_stats);
01841     return -1;
01842   }
01843   
01844   /* retrieving current thread stats */
01845   FSAL_get_stats( &call_stat,FALSE );
01846   
01847   /* displaying stats */
01848   /* header: */
01849   fprintf(output,"Function             | Nb_Calls    | Success     | Retryable   | Unrecoverable\n");
01850   /* content */
01851   for (i=0;i<FSAL_NB_FUNC;i++)
01852     fprintf(output,"%-20s | %11u | %11u | %11u | %11u\n",
01853           fsal_function_names[i],
01854           call_stat.func_stats.nb_call[i],
01855           call_stat.func_stats.nb_success[i],
01856           call_stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i],
01857           call_stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]
01858           );
01859   
01860   return 0; 
01861 }
01862 
01863 
01865 int fn_fsal_su( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
01866          char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01867          FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01868        ){
01869   
01870   char * str_uid;
01871   fsal_uid_t  uid; 
01872   fsal_status_t st;
01873   struct passwd * pw_struct;
01874   int i;
01875 
01876 # define MAX_GRPS  128
01877   gid_t   groups_tab[MAX_GRPS];
01878   int     nb_grp;
01879 
01880   static char help_stats[]=
01881   "usage: su <uid>\n";
01882 
01883   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01884 
01885   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01886   if (!is_loaded){
01887     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
01888     return -1;
01889   }
01890   
01891   
01892   /* initialize current thread */
01893     
01894   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
01895   
01896   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
01897   { 
01898     int rc;
01899     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
01900     if (rc != 0) return rc;
01901   }
01902   
01903   /* UID arg expected */
01904   if (argc!=2){
01905     fprintf(output,help_stats);
01906     return -1;
01907   } else {
01908     str_uid = argv[1];
01909   }
01910   
01911   if ( isdigit( str_uid[0] ) )
01912   {
01913     if ( (uid = my_atoi(str_uid) ) == (uid_t)-1 )
01914     {
01915       fprintf(output,"Error: invalid uid \"%s\"\n",str_uid);
01916       return -1;
01917     }
01918     pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
01919   }
01920   else
01921   {
01922     pw_struct = getpwnam( str_uid );
01923   }
01924   
01925   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
01926   {
01927     fprintf( output, "Unknown user %s\n", str_uid );
01928     return errno;
01929   }
01930   
01931   nb_grp = getugroups( MAX_GRPS, groups_tab, pw_struct->pw_name, pw_struct->pw_gid );
01932   
01933   fprintf( output, "Changing user to : %s ( uid = %d, gid = %d )\n",
01934        pw_struct->pw_name , pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid );
01935   
01936   if ( nb_grp > 1 )
01937   {
01938     fprintf( output, "altgroups = ");
01939     for ( i = 1; i < nb_grp; i++ )
01940     {      
01941       if ( i == 1 )
01942         fprintf( output, "%d", groups_tab[i]);
01943       else
01944         fprintf( output, ", %d", groups_tab[i]);      
01945     }
01946     fprintf( output, "\n");
01947   }
01948 
01949   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &context->context, &context->exp_context,
01950                               pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid,
01951                               groups_tab, nb_grp );
01952       
01953   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
01954   {
01955     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_GetUserCred:");
01956     print_fsal_status(output,st);
01957     fprintf(output,"\n");
01958     return st.major;
01959   }
01960   
01961   fprintf(output,"Done.\n");
01962   
01963   return 0;
01964   
01965 }
01966

01969 
01971 int fn_fsal_unlink( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01972         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01973         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
01974       ){
01975   
01976   
01977   static char format[]="hv";
01978    
01979   static char help_unlink[]=
01980   "usage: unlink [-h][-v] <path>\n";
01981 
01982   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01983   fsal_handle_t new_hdl;
01984   fsal_status_t st;
01985   int rc,option;
01986   int flag_v=0;
01987   int flag_h=0;
01988   int err_flag=0;
01989   
01990   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01991   char * path;
01992   char * file;
01993   
01994   fsal_name_t objname;
01995     
01996   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
01997 
01998   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01999   if (!is_loaded){
02000     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02001     return -1;
02002   }  
02003   
02004   /* initialize current thread */
02005     
02006   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02007   
02008   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02009   { 
02010     int rc;
02011     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02012     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02013   }
02014   
02015   /* analysing options */
02016   getopt_init();
02017   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02018     switch(option){
02019       case 'v':
02020         if (flag_v)
02021           fprintf(output,
02022               "unlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02023         else flag_v++;
02024         break;
02025       case 'h':
02026         if ( flag_h )
02027           fprintf(output,
02028               "unlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02029         else flag_h++;
02030         break;
02031       case '?':
02032         fprintf(output,"unlink: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02033         err_flag ++;
02034         break;
02035     }    
02036   }
02037   
02038   if (flag_h){
02039     fprintf(output,help_unlink);
02040     return 0;
02041   }
02042   
02043   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
02044   if (Optind != (argc-1)){
02045     err_flag ++;
02046   } else {
02047     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02048     split_path(tmp_path, &path, &file);
02049   }  
02050   
02051   if (err_flag){
02052     fprintf(output,help_unlink);
02053     return -1;
02054   }
02055     
02056   /* copy current path. */
02057   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02058   
02059   /* retrieves path handle*/
02060   if (rc = 
02061       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02062                 path,context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
02063     return rc;
02064 
02065   /* create fsal_name_t */
02066   st = FSAL_str2name(
02067       file,
02068       256,
02069       &objname
02070     );
02071   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st )){
02072     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02073     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02074     fprintf(output,"\n");
02075     return st.major;
02076   }
02077 
02078   
02079   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_unlink(&new_hdl,&objname,&context->context,NULL))){
02080     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_unlink:");
02081     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02082     fprintf(output,"\n");
02083     return st.major;
02084   }
02085 
02086   if (flag_v)
02087     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully unlinked\n",glob_path,file);
02088 
02089       
02090   return 0;
02091   
02092 }
02093 
02094 
02096 int fn_fsal_mkdir( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02097         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02098         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02099       ){
02100   
02101   
02102   static char format[]="hv";
02103    
02104   static char help_mkdir[]=
02105   "usage: mkdir [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02106   "       path: path of the directory to be created\n"
02107   "       mode: octal mode for the directory is to be created (ex: 755)\n" ;
02108 
02109   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02110   fsal_handle_t new_hdl,subdir_hdl;
02111   fsal_status_t st;
02112   int rc,option;
02113   int flag_v=0;
02114   int flag_h=0;
02115   int err_flag=0;
02116   int mode;
02117   fsal_accessmode_t fsalmode = 0755;
02118   
02119   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02120   char * path;
02121   char * file;
02122   char * strmode;
02123   
02124   fsal_name_t objname;
02125     
02126   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02127 
02128   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02129   if (!is_loaded){
02130     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02131     return -1;
02132   }  
02133   
02134   /* initialize current thread */
02135     
02136   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02137   
02138   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02139   { 
02140     int rc;
02141     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02142     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02143   }
02144     
02145   /* analysing options */
02146   getopt_init();
02147   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02148     switch(option){
02149       case 'v':
02150         if (flag_v)
02151           fprintf(output,
02152               "mkdir: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02153         else flag_v++;
02154         break;
02155       case 'h':
02156         if ( flag_h )
02157           fprintf(output,
02158               "mkdir: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02159         else flag_h++;
02160         break;
02161       case '?':
02162         fprintf(output,"mkdir: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02163         err_flag ++;
02164         break;
02165     }    
02166   }
02167   
02168   if (flag_h){
02169     fprintf(output,help_mkdir);
02170     return 0;
02171   }
02172   
02173   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02174   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
02175     err_flag ++;
02176   } else {
02177     
02178     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02179     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&file);
02180     
02181     strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02182   
02183     /* converting mode string to FSAL mode string */
02184     mode = atomode(strmode);  
02185     if (mode<0) err_flag ++;
02186     else {
02187 
02188       fsalmode = 0;
02189 
02190       if ( mode & S_ISUID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SUID;
02191       if ( mode & S_ISGID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SGID;
02192 
02193       if ( mode & S_IRUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RUSR;
02194       if ( mode & S_IWUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WUSR;
02195       if ( mode & S_IXUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XUSR;
02196 
02197       if ( mode & S_IRGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RGRP;
02198       if ( mode & S_IWGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WGRP;
02199       if ( mode & S_IXGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XGRP;
02200 
02201       if ( mode & S_IROTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_ROTH;
02202       if ( mode & S_IWOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WOTH;
02203       if ( mode & S_IXOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XOTH;
02204 
02205     }
02206     
02207   }
02208   
02209   
02210   if (err_flag){
02211     fprintf(output,help_mkdir);
02212     return -1;
02213   }
02214     
02215   /* copy current path. */
02216   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02217   
02218   /* retrieves path handle*/
02219   if (rc = 
02220       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02221                 path,context->current_dir,&new_hdl,output))
02222     return rc;
02223 
02224   /* create fsal_name_t */
02225   st = FSAL_str2name(
02226       file,
02227       256,
02228       &objname
02229     );
02230   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st )){
02231     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02232     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02233     fprintf(output,"\n");
02234     return st.major;
02235   }
02236 
02237   
02238   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_mkdir(&new_hdl,&objname,&context->context,
02239                                     fsalmode,&subdir_hdl,NULL))){
02240     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_mkdir:");
02241     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02242     fprintf(output,"\n");
02243     return st.major;
02244   }
02245 
02246   if (flag_v)
02247   {
02248     char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];  
02249     snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&subdir_hdl);
02250   
02251     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created (@%s) \n",glob_path,file,buff);
02252 
02253   }
02254 
02255       
02256   return 0;
02257   
02258 }
02259 
02260 
02261 
02262 
02264 int fn_fsal_rename( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02265         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02266         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02267       ){
02268   
02269   
02270   static char format[]="hv";
02271    
02272   static char help_rename[]=
02273   "usage: rename [-h][-v] <src> <dest>\n";
02274 
02275   char src_glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02276   char tgt_glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02277   
02278   fsal_handle_t src_path_handle, tgt_path_handle;
02279   fsal_name_t   src_name, tgt_name;
02280   
02281   fsal_status_t st;
02282   int rc,option;
02283   int flag_v=0;
02284   int flag_h=0;
02285   int err_flag=0;
02286   
02287   char tmp_path1[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02288   char tmp_path2[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02289   char * src_path;
02290   char * src_file;
02291   char * tgt_path;
02292   char * tgt_file;
02293       
02294   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02295 
02296   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02297   if (!is_loaded){
02298     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02299     return -1;
02300   }  
02301   
02302   /* initialize current thread */
02303     
02304   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02305   
02306   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02307   { 
02308     int rc;
02309     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02310     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02311   }
02312   
02313   /* analysing options */
02314   getopt_init();
02315   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02316     switch(option){
02317       case 'v':
02318         if (flag_v)
02319           fprintf(output,
02320               "rename: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02321         else flag_v++;
02322         break;
02323       case 'h':
02324         if ( flag_h )
02325           fprintf(output,
02326               "rename: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02327         else flag_h++;
02328         break;
02329       case '?':
02330         fprintf(output,"rename: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02331         err_flag ++;
02332         break;
02333     }    
02334   }
02335   
02336   if (flag_h){
02337     fprintf(output,help_rename);
02338     return 0;
02339   }
02340   
02341   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02342   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
02343     err_flag ++;
02344   } else {
02345     
02346     strncpy(tmp_path1,argv[Optind],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02347     split_path(tmp_path1,&src_path,&src_file);
02348 
02349     strncpy(tmp_path2,argv[Optind+1],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02350     split_path(tmp_path2,&tgt_path,&tgt_file);
02351     
02352   }
02353   
02354   if (err_flag){
02355     fprintf(output,help_rename);
02356     return -1;
02357   }
02358   
02359   if (flag_v)
02360     fprintf(output,"Renaming %s (dir %s) to %s (dir %s)\n",
02361         src_file,src_path,tgt_file,tgt_path);
02362   
02363   /* copy current path. */
02364   strncpy(src_glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02365   strncpy(tgt_glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02366   
02367   /* retrieves paths handles */
02368   if (rc = 
02369       solvepath(src_glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02370                 src_path,context->current_dir,&src_path_handle,output))
02371     return rc;
02372 
02373   if (rc = 
02374       solvepath(tgt_glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02375                 tgt_path,context->current_dir,&tgt_path_handle,output))
02376     return rc;
02377 
02378   
02379   /* create fsal_name_t */
02380   
02381   st = FSAL_str2name( src_file, 256,  &src_name );
02382   
02383   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02384     
02385     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02386     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02387     fprintf(output,"\n");
02388     return st.major;
02389     
02390   }
02391 
02392   st = FSAL_str2name( tgt_file, 256,  &tgt_name );
02393   
02394   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02395     
02396     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02397     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02398     fprintf(output,"\n");
02399     return st.major;
02400     
02401   }
02402 
02403   /* Rename operation */  
02404   
02405   st = FSAL_rename(
02406     &src_path_handle,      /* IN */
02407     &src_name,             /* IN */
02408     &tgt_path_handle,      /* IN */
02409     &tgt_name,             /* IN */
02410     &context->context,        /* IN */
02411     NULL,
02412     NULL
02413   );
02414   
02415   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02416     
02417     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_rename:");
02418     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02419     fprintf(output,"\n");
02420     return st.major;
02421     
02422   }
02423 
02424   if (flag_v)
02425     fprintf( output,"%s/%s successfully renamed to %s/%s\n",
02426           src_glob_path, src_file,
02427           tgt_glob_path, tgt_file
02428         );
02429 
02430       
02431   return 0;
02432   
02433 }
02434 
02435 
02436 
02437 
02439 int fn_fsal_ln( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02440         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02441         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02442       ){
02443   
02444   
02445   static char format[]="hv";
02446    
02447   static char help_ln[]=
02448   "ln: create a symbolic link.\n"
02449   "usage: ln [-h][-v] <link_content> <link_path>\n"
02450   "       link_content: content of the symbolic link to be created\n"
02451   "       link_path: path of the symbolic link to be created\n";
02452 
02453   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02454   fsal_handle_t path_hdl,link_hdl;
02455   fsal_status_t st;
02456   int rc,option;
02457   int flag_v=0;
02458   int flag_h=0;
02459   int err_flag=0;
02460   
02461   char * content = NULL;
02462   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02463   char * path;
02464   char * name;
02465   
02466   fsal_name_t objname;
02467   fsal_path_t objcontent;
02468     
02469   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02470 
02471   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02472   if (!is_loaded){
02473     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02474     return -1;
02475   }  
02476   
02477   /* initialize current thread */
02478     
02479   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02480   
02481   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02482   { 
02483     int rc;
02484     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02485     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02486   }
02487   
02488   /* analysing options */
02489   getopt_init();
02490   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02491     switch(option){
02492       case 'v':
02493         if (flag_v)
02494           fprintf(output,
02495               "ln: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02496         else flag_v++;
02497         break;
02498       case 'h':
02499         if ( flag_h )
02500           fprintf(output,
02501               "ln: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02502         else flag_h++;
02503         break;
02504       case '?':
02505         fprintf(output,"ln: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02506         err_flag ++;
02507         break;
02508     }    
02509   }
02510   
02511   if (flag_h){
02512     fprintf(output,help_ln);
02513     return 0;
02514   }
02515   
02516   /* 2 args expected */
02517   
02518   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
02519     
02520     content = argv[Optind];
02521     
02522     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02523     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
02524 
02525   } else {    
02526     err_flag ++;    
02527   }
02528   
02529   
02530   if (err_flag){
02531     fprintf(output,help_ln);
02532     return -1;
02533   }
02534     
02535   /* copy current path. */
02536   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02537   
02538   /* retrieves path handle*/
02539   if (rc = 
02540       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02541                 path,context->current_dir,&path_hdl,output))
02542     return rc;
02543 
02544   /* create fsal_name_t */  
02545   st = FSAL_str2name(
02546       name,
02547       256,
02548       &objname
02549     );
02550   
02551   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02552     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02553     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02554     fprintf(output,"\n");
02555     return st.major;
02556   }
02557 
02558   /* create fsal_path_t */  
02559   st = FSAL_str2path(
02560       content,
02561       256,
02562       &objcontent
02563     );
02564   
02565   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02566     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2path:");
02567     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02568     fprintf(output,"\n");
02569     return st.major;
02570   }
02571 
02572   st = FSAL_symlink(
02573           &path_hdl,  /* IN - parent dir handle */
02574           &objname,   /* IN - link name */
02575           &objcontent,/* IN - link content */
02576           &context->context,      /* IN - user contexte */
02577           0777,       /* IN (ignored) */
02578           &link_hdl,  /* OUT - link handle*/
02579           NULL );     /* OUT - link attributes */
02580   
02581   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) ){
02582     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_symlink:");
02583     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02584     fprintf(output,"\n");
02585     return st.major;
02586   }
02587 
02588   if (flag_v)
02589   {
02590     char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];  
02591     snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&link_hdl);
02592   
02593     fprintf(output,"%s/%s -> %s successfully created (@%s) \n",path,name,content,buff);
02594 
02595   }
02596 
02597       
02598   return 0;
02599   
02600 }

02604 
02606 int fn_fsal_hardlink( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02607         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02608         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02609       ){
02610   
02611   
02612   static char format[]="hv";
02613    
02614   static char help_hardlink[]=
02615   "hardlink: create a hard link.\n"
02616   "usage: hardlink [-h][-v] <target> <new_path>\n"
02617   "       target: path of an existing file.\n"
02618   "       new_path: path of the hardlink to be created\n";
02619 
02620   char glob_path_target[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02621   char glob_path_link[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02622   
02623   fsal_handle_t target_hdl, dir_hdl;
02624   fsal_name_t   link_name;
02625   
02626   fsal_status_t st;
02627   int rc,option;
02628   int flag_v=0;
02629   int flag_h=0;
02630   int err_flag=0;
02631   
02632   char * target = NULL;
02633   
02634   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02635   char * path;
02636   char * name;
02637       
02638   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02639 
02640   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02641   if (!is_loaded){
02642     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02643     return -1;
02644   }  
02645   
02646   /* initialize current thread */
02647     
02648   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02649   
02650   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02651   { 
02652     int rc;
02653     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02654     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02655   }
02656   
02657   /* analysing options */
02658   getopt_init();
02659   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02660     switch(option){
02661       case 'v':
02662         if (flag_v)
02663           fprintf(output,
02664               "hardlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02665         else flag_v++;
02666         break;
02667       case 'h':
02668         if ( flag_h )
02669           fprintf(output,
02670               "hardlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02671         else flag_h++;
02672         break;
02673       case '?':
02674         fprintf(output,"hardlink: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02675         err_flag ++;
02676         break;
02677     }    
02678   }
02679   
02680   if (flag_h){
02681     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
02682     return 0;
02683   }
02684   
02685   /* 2 args expected */
02686   
02687   if ( Optind == (argc-2) ){
02688     
02689     target = argv[Optind];
02690     
02691     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind+1],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02692     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&name);
02693 
02694   } else {    
02695     err_flag ++;    
02696   }
02697   
02698   
02699   if (err_flag){
02700     fprintf(output,help_hardlink);
02701     return -1;
02702   }
02703     
02704   /* copy current path. */
02705   strncpy(glob_path_target,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02706   strncpy(glob_path_link,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02707   
02708   /* retrieves path handle for target */
02709   if (rc = 
02710       solvepath(glob_path_target,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02711                 target,context->current_dir,&target_hdl,output))
02712     return rc;
02713 
02714   /* retrieves path handle for parent dir */
02715   if (rc = 
02716       solvepath(glob_path_link,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02717                 path,context->current_dir,&dir_hdl,output))
02718     return rc;
02719   
02720   
02721   /* create fsal_name_t */
02722   st = FSAL_str2name(
02723       name,
02724       256,
02725       &link_name
02726     );
02727   
02728   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
02729     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02730     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02731     fprintf(output,"\n");
02732     return st.major;
02733   }
02734 
02735 
02736   st = FSAL_link(
02737           &target_hdl,/* IN - target file */
02738           &dir_hdl,   /* IN - parent dir handle */
02739           &link_name, /* IN - link name */
02740           &context->context,  /* IN - user contexte */
02741           NULL );     /* OUT - new attributes */
02742   
02743   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) ){
02744     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_link:");
02745     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02746     fprintf(output,"\n");
02747     return st.major;
02748   }
02749 
02750   if (flag_v)
02751   {
02752     fprintf(output,"%s/%s <=> %s successfully created\n",path,name,glob_path_target);
02753 
02754   }
02755 
02756       
02757   return 0;
02758   
02759 }
02760 
02761 
02762 
02763 
02765 int fn_fsal_create( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02766         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02767         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02768       ){
02769   
02770   
02771   static char format[]="hv";
02772    
02773   static char help_create[]=
02774   "usage: create [-h][-v] <path> <mode>\n"
02775   "       path: path of the file to be created\n"
02776   "       mode: octal access mode for the file to be created (ex: 644)\n" ;
02777 
02778   char glob_path_dir[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02779   fsal_handle_t dir_hdl,file_hdl;
02780   
02781   fsal_status_t st;
02782   int rc,option;
02783   int flag_v=0;
02784   int flag_h=0;
02785   int err_flag=0;
02786   int mode;
02787   fsal_accessmode_t fsalmode = 0644;
02788   
02789   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02790   char * path;
02791   char * file;
02792   char * strmode;
02793   
02794   fsal_name_t objname;
02795     
02796   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02797 
02798   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02799   if (!is_loaded){
02800     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02801     return -1;
02802   }  
02803   
02804   /* initialize current thread */
02805     
02806   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02807   
02808   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02809   { 
02810     int rc;
02811     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02812     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02813   }
02814   
02815   /* analysing options */
02816   getopt_init();
02817   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
02818     switch(option){
02819       case 'v':
02820         if (flag_v)
02821           fprintf(output,
02822               "create: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02823         else flag_v++;
02824         break;
02825       case 'h':
02826         if ( flag_h )
02827           fprintf(output,
02828               "create: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02829         else flag_h++;
02830         break;
02831       case '?':
02832         fprintf(output,"create: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02833         err_flag ++;
02834         break;
02835     }
02836   }
02837   
02838   if (flag_h){
02839     fprintf(output,help_create);
02840     return 0;
02841   }
02842   
02843   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02844   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
02845     err_flag ++;
02846   } else {
02847     
02848     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02849     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&file);
02850     
02851     strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02852   
02853     /* converting mode string to FSAL mode string */
02854     mode = atomode(strmode);  
02855     if (mode<0) err_flag ++;
02856     else {
02857 
02858       fsalmode = 0;
02859 
02860       if ( mode & S_ISUID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SUID;
02861       if ( mode & S_ISGID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SGID;
02862 
02863       if ( mode & S_IRUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RUSR;
02864       if ( mode & S_IWUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WUSR;
02865       if ( mode & S_IXUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XUSR;
02866 
02867       if ( mode & S_IRGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RGRP;
02868       if ( mode & S_IWGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WGRP;
02869       if ( mode & S_IXGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XGRP;
02870 
02871       if ( mode & S_IROTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_ROTH;
02872       if ( mode & S_IWOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WOTH;
02873       if ( mode & S_IXOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XOTH;
02874 
02875     }
02876     
02877   }
02878   
02879   
02880   if (err_flag){
02881     fprintf(output,help_create);
02882     return -1;
02883   }
02884     
02885   /* copy current path. */
02886   strncpy(glob_path_dir,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02887   
02888   /* retrieves path handle*/
02889   if (rc = 
02890       solvepath(glob_path_dir,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02891                 path,context->current_dir,&dir_hdl,output))
02892     return rc;
02893 
02894   /* create fsal_name_t */
02895   st = FSAL_str2name(
02896       file,
02897       256,
02898       &objname
02899     );
02900   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st )){
02901     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02902     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02903     fprintf(output,"\n");
02904     return st.major;
02905   }
02906 
02907   st = FSAL_create(
02908           &dir_hdl,  /* IN */
02909           &objname,  /* IN */
02910           &context->context,     /* IN */
02911           fsalmode,  /* IN */
02912           &file_hdl, /* OUT */
02913           /*&context->current_fd,*/ /* OUT */
02914           NULL  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
02915         );
02916   
02917   
02918   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)){
02919     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_create:");
02920     print_fsal_status(output,st);
02921     fprintf(output,"\n");
02922     return st.major;
02923   }
02924 
02925   if (flag_v)
02926   {
02927     char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];  
02928     snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&file_hdl);
02929   
02930     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created (@%s) \n",glob_path_dir,file,buff);
02931 
02932   }
02933 
02934       
02935   return 0;
02936   
02937 }
02938 
02939 
02940 
02941 /* setattr
02942  *
02943  * syntax of command line:
02944  * setattr file_path  attribute_name  attribute_value
02945  *
02946  */
02947 int fn_fsal_setattr(
02948         int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02949         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02950         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
02951       )
02952 {
02953   
02954   static char format[]="hv";
02955    
02956   static char help_setattr[]=
02957   "usage: setattr [-h][-v] <path> <attr>=<value>,<attr>=<value>,...\n";
02958 
02959   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
02960   fsal_handle_t obj_hdl;              /* handle of the object */
02961   fsal_attrib_list_t set_attrs;       /* attributes to be setted */
02962   fsal_status_t st;                   /* FSAL return status */
02963   
02964   int rc,option;
02965   int flag_v=0;
02966   int flag_h=0;
02967   int err_flag=0;
02968   
02969   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */
02970   char * attr_list = NULL;   /* attribute list */
02971       
02972   
02973   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
02974 
02975   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02976   if (!is_loaded){
02977     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
02978     return -1;
02979   }  
02980   
02981   /* initialize current thread */
02982     
02983   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
02984   
02985   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
02986   { 
02987     int rc;
02988     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
02989     if (rc != 0) return rc;
02990   }
02991   
02992   /* analysing options */
02993   
02994   getopt_init();
02995   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1)
02996   {   
02997     switch(option){
02998       
02999       case 'v':
03000         if (flag_v)
03001           fprintf(output,
03002               "setattr: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03003         else flag_v++;
03004         break;
03005         
03006       case 'h':
03007         if ( flag_h )
03008           fprintf(output,
03009               "setattr: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03010         else flag_h++;
03011         break;
