03012         
03013       case '?':
03014         fprintf(output,"setattr: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03015         err_flag ++;
03016         break;
03017     }    
03018   }
03019   
03020   if (flag_h){
03021     
03022     shell_attribute_t * curr_attr;
03023     
03024     /* print usage */
03025     fprintf(output,help_setattr);
03026     
03027     fprintf(output,"\n<attr> can be one of the following values:\n");
03028     
03029     /* print attribute list */
03030     
03031     for ( curr_attr = shell_attr_list; curr_attr->attr_type != ATTR_NONE; curr_attr++ )
03032     {
03033       switch( curr_attr->attr_type)
03034       {              
03035         case ATTR_32:        
03036           fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t 32 bits integer\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
03037           break;
03038         case ATTR_64:
03039           fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t 64 bits integer\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
03040           break;
03041         case ATTR_OCTAL:
03042           fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t octal\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
03043           break;
03044         case ATTR_TIME:
03045           fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t time (format: YYYYMMDDhhmmss)\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
03046           break;
03047       }
03048     }    
03049     
03050     return 0;
03051   }
03052   
03053   /* Exactly 2 args expected (path and attributes) */
03054   
03055   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
03056     err_flag ++;
03057   } else {
03058     file = argv[Optind];
03059     attr_list = argv[Optind+1];
03060   }
03061   
03062   if (err_flag){
03063     fprintf(output,help_setattr);
03064     return -1;
03065   }
03066     
03067   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03068   
03069   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03070   
03071   /* retrieve handle to the file whose attributes are to be changed */
03072   
03073   rc = solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->current_dir,
03074       &obj_hdl, output ) ;
03075   if (rc) return rc;
03076   
03077   /* Convert the peers (attr_name,attr_val) to an FSAL attribute structure. */
03078   rc = MkFSALSetAttrStruct( attr_list, &set_attrs );
03079   
03080   /* interprets output code */
03081   switch (rc)
03082   {
03083     case 0:
03084       /* OK */
03085       break;
03086       
03087     case EFAULT:
03088       fprintf(output,"setattr: Internal error.\n");
03089       return rc;
03090       
03091     case ENOENT:
03092       fprintf(output,"setattr: Unknown attribute in list %s\n",attr_list);
03093       return rc;
03094       
03095     case EINVAL:
03096       fprintf(output,"setattr: Invalid value for attribute in list %s\n", attr_list );
03097       return rc;
03098       
03099     default:
03100       fprintf(output,"setattr: Error %d converting attributes.\n",rc );
03101       return rc;
03102   }
03103   
03104   /* if verbose mode is on, we print the attributes to be set */    
03105   if (flag_v){
03106       print_fsal_attributes( set_attrs, output );
03107   }
03108   
03109   
03110   /* executes set attrs */
03111   
03112   st = FSAL_setattrs( &obj_hdl, &context->context, &set_attrs, NULL );
03113     
03114   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03115     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_setattrs:");
03116     print_fsal_status(output,st);
03117     fprintf(output,"\n");
03118     return st.major;
03119   }
03120   
03121   return 0;
03122   
03123 }
03124 
03125 
03126 
03133 int fn_fsal_access(
03134         int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03135         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03136         FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */
03137       )
03138 {
03139   
03140   static char format[]="hvA";
03141    
03142   static char help_access[]=
03143   "usage: access [-h][-v][-A] <rights> <path>\n"
03144   "\n"
03145   "   -h : print this help\n"
03146   "   -v : verbose mode\n"
03147   "   -A : test access from attributes\n"
03148   "        ( call to getattr + test_access instead of access )\n"
03149   "\n"
03150   " <rights> : a set of the following characters:\n"
03151   "    F: test file existence\n"
03152   "    R: test read permission\n"
03153   "    W: test write permission\n"
03154   "    X: test execute permission\n"
03155   "\n"
03156   "Example: access -A RX my_dir\n"
03157   "test read and exec rights for directory \"my_dir\"\n"
03158   "by doing a getattr and a test_access call.\n\n";
03159   
03160 
03161   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03162   fsal_handle_t       obj_hdl;        /* handle of the object */
03163   fsal_accessflags_t  test_perms;     /* permissions to be tested */
03164   fsal_status_t st;                   /* FSAL return status */
03165   
03166   int rc,option;
03167   unsigned int i;
03168   int flag_v=0;
03169   int flag_h=0;
03170   int flag_A=0;
03171   int err_flag=0;
03172   
03173   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
03174   char * str_perms = NULL;   /* string that represents the permissions to be tested */
03175       
03176   
03177   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
03178 
03179   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03180   if (!is_loaded){
03181     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
03182     return -1;
03183   }  
03184   
03185   /* initialize current thread */
03186     
03187   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
03188   
03189   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
03190   { 
03191     int rc;
03192     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
03193     if (rc != 0) return rc;
03194   }
03195   
03196   /* analysing options */
03197   
03198   getopt_init();
03199   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1)
03200   {   
03201     switch(option){
03202       
03203       case 'v':
03204         if (flag_v)
03205           fprintf(output,
03206               "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03207         else flag_v++;
03208         break;
03209         
03210       case 'h':
03211         if ( flag_h )
03212           fprintf(output,
03213               "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03214         else flag_h++;
03215         break;
03216         
03217       case 'A':
03218         if ( flag_A )
03219           fprintf(output,
03220               "access: warning: option 'A' has been specified more than once.\n");
03221         else flag_A++;
03222         break;
03223         
03224       case '?':
03225         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03226         err_flag ++;
03227         break;
03228     }    
03229   }
03230   
03231   if (flag_h){
03232     
03233     /* print usage */
03234     fprintf(output,help_access);    
03235     return 0;
03236     
03237   }
03238   
03239   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
03240   
03241   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
03242     err_flag ++;
03243   } else {
03244     str_perms = argv[Optind];
03245     file = argv[Optind+1];
03246   }
03247   
03248   if (err_flag){
03249     fprintf(output,help_access);
03250     return -1;
03251   }
03252     
03253   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03254   
03255   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03256   
03257   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03258   
03259   rc = solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->current_dir, &obj_hdl, output );
03260   if (rc) return rc;
03261     
03262   
03263   /* Convert the permission string to an fsal access test. */
03264   
03265   test_perms = 0;
03266   
03267   for ( i=0; i < strlen(str_perms); i++ )
03268   {    
03269     switch( str_perms[i] )
03270     {
03271       case 'F':        
03272         if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"F_OK flag\n");
03273         test_perms |= FSAL_F_OK ;
03274         break;
03275         
03276       case 'R':
03277         if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"R_OK flag\n");
03278         test_perms |= FSAL_R_OK ;
03279         break;
03280         
03281       case 'W':
03282         if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"W_OK flag\n");
03283         test_perms |= FSAL_W_OK ;
03284         break;
03285         
03286       case 'X':      
03287         if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"X_OK flag\n");
03288         test_perms |= FSAL_X_OK ;
03289         break;
03290         
03291       default:
03292         fprintf(output,"**** Invalid test: %c ****\n", str_perms[i] );
03293         fprintf(output,help_access);
03294         return -1;
03295     }    
03296   }  
03297   
03298   
03299   /* Call to FSAL */
03300   
03301   if ( flag_A )
03302   {
03303     fsal_attrib_list_t attributes;
03304         
03305     /* 1st method: get attr and test_access */  
03306     
03307     FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attributes.asked_attributes );
03308     FSAL_SET_MASK( attributes.asked_attributes,
03309         FSAL_ATTR_MODE | FSAL_ATTR_OWNER |  FSAL_ATTR_GROUP | FSAL_ATTR_ACL );
03310     
03311     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Getting file attributes...\n");
03312     
03313     st = FSAL_getattrs( &obj_hdl, &context->context, &attributes );
03314     
03315     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03316       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_getattrs:");
03317       print_fsal_status(output,st);
03318       fprintf(output,"\n");
03319       return st.major;
03320     }
03321 
03322     if ( flag_v )
03323     {
03324       print_fsal_attributes( attributes, output );
03325     }
03326         
03327     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Testing access rights...\n");
03328     
03329     st = FSAL_test_access( &context->context, test_perms, &attributes);
03330     
03331     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03332       
03333       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_test_access:");
03334       print_fsal_status(output,st);
03335       fprintf(output,"\n");
03336       return st.major;
03337       
03338     } else {
03339       
03340       fprintf(output,"access: Access granted.\n");
03341       return 0;
03342         
03343     }
03344     
03345       
03346   }
03347   else
03348   {
03349     /* 2nd method: simply calling access */
03350     
03351     if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Calling access\n");
03352     
03353     st = FSAL_access( &obj_hdl, &context->context ,test_perms, NULL );
03354     
03355     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03356       
03357       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_access:");
03358       print_fsal_status(output,st);
03359       fprintf(output,"\n");
03360       return st.major;
03361       
03362     } else {
03363       
03364       fprintf(output,"access: Access granted.\n");
03365       return 0;     
03366     }
03367   
03368   }
03369   
03370 }
03371 
03372 
03373 
03374 
03375 
03376 
03378 int fn_fsal_truncate( int argc ,  /* IN : number of args in argv */
03379         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
03380         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
03381       ){
03382   
03383   
03384   static char format[]="hv";
03385    
03386   static char help_truncate[]=
03387   "usage: truncate [-h][-v] <file> <size>\n";
03388 
03389   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
03390   fsal_handle_t filehdl;
03391   
03392   fsal_status_t st;
03393   fsal_size_t trunc_size;
03394   
03395   int rc,option;
03396   int flag_v=0;
03397   int flag_h=0;
03398   int err_flag=0;
03399   
03400   char * file = NULL;
03401   char * str_size = NULL;
03402     
03403   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
03404 
03405   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03406   if (!is_loaded){
03407     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
03408     return -1;
03409   }  
03410   
03411   /* initialize current thread */
03412     
03413   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
03414   
03415   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
03416   { 
03417     int rc;
03418     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
03419     if (rc != 0) return rc;
03420   }
03421   
03422   /* analysing options */
03423   getopt_init();
03424   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03425     switch(option){
03426       case 'v':
03427         if (flag_v)
03428           fprintf(output,
03429               "truncate: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03430         else flag_v++;
03431         break;
03432       case 'h':
03433         if ( flag_h )
03434           fprintf(output,
03435               "truncate: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03436         else flag_h++;
03437         break;
03438       case '?':
03439         fprintf(output,"truncate: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03440         err_flag ++;
03441         break;
03442     }    
03443   }
03444   
03445   if (flag_h){
03446     fprintf(output,help_truncate);
03447     return 0;
03448   }
03449   
03450   /* Exactly two arg expected */
03451   if (Optind != (argc-2)){
03452     err_flag ++;
03453   } else {
03454     file = argv[Optind];
03455     str_size = argv[Optind+1];
03456     
03457     rc = ato64( str_size, &trunc_size );
03458     if ( rc == -1 ){
03459       fprintf(output,"truncate: error: invalid trunc size \"%s\"\n",
03460           str_size);
03461       err_flag++;
03462     }
03463     
03464   }
03465   
03466   if (err_flag){
03467     fprintf(output,help_truncate);
03468     return -1;
03469   }
03470     
03471   /* copy current path. */
03472   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03473   
03474   /* retrieves object handle*/
03475   if (rc = 
03476       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
03477                 file,context->current_dir,&filehdl,output))
03478     return rc;
03479 
03480   if (flag_v)
03481     fprintf(output,"Truncating \"%s\" to %llu bytes.\n",glob_path,trunc_size);
03482   
03483   st = FSAL_truncate(
03484       &filehdl,
03485       &context->context,
03486       trunc_size,
03487       NULL, /* Will fail with FSAL_PROXY */
03488       NULL );
03489     
03490   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03491     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_truncate:");
03492     print_fsal_status(output,st);
03493     fprintf(output,"\n");
03494     return st.major;
03495   }
03496   
03497   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Truncate operation completed sucessfully.\n");   
03498     
03499   return 0;
03500   
03501 }
03502 
03503 
03508 int fn_fsal_open_byname(
03509         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
03510         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
03511         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
03512       )
03513   {
03514   
03515   static char format[]="hv";
03516    
03517   static char help_open[]=
03518     "usage: open_byname [-h][-v] <path> [<oflags>]\n"
03519     "   where <oflags> is a set of the following values:\n"
03520     "   'r': read, 'w': write, 'a': append, 't': truncate.\n";
03521 
03522   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
03523   fsal_name_t filename ;
03524  
03525   fsal_status_t st;
03526   
03527   int option;
03528   int flag_v=0;
03529   int flag_h=0;
03530   int err_flag=0;
03531 
03532   fsal_openflags_t o_flags;
03533       
03534   int flag_r=0;
03535   int flag_w=0;
03536   int flag_a=0;
03537   int flag_t=0;
03538   
03539     
03540   char * file = NULL;
03541   char * opt_str;
03542     
03543   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
03544 
03545   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03546   if (!is_loaded){
03547     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
03548     return -1;
03549   }  
03550   
03551   /* initialize current thread */
03552     
03553   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
03554   
03555   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
03556   { 
03557     int rc;
03558     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
03559     if (rc != 0) return rc;
03560   }
03561   
03562   /* is a file already opened ? */
03563   if ( context->opened )
03564   {
03565     fprintf(output,"Error: a file is already opened. Use 'close' command first.\n");
03566     return -1;
03567   }
03568   
03569   /* analysing options */
03570   
03571   getopt_init();
03572   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03573     switch(option){
03574       case 'v':
03575         if (flag_v)
03576           fprintf(output,
03577               "open: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03578         else flag_v++;
03579         break;
03580       case 'h':
03581         if ( flag_h )
03582           fprintf(output,
03583               "open: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03584         else flag_h++;
03585         break;
03586       case '?':
03587         fprintf(output,"open: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03588         err_flag ++;
03589         break;
03590     }    
03591   }
03592   
03593   if (flag_h){
03594     fprintf(output,help_open);
03595     return 0;
03596   }
03597   
03598   /* one or two args expected */
03599   if ( Optind > (argc-1) )
03600     err_flag ++;
03601   else
03602   {
03603     file = argv[Optind];
03604     
03605     Optind++;
03606     
03607     /* optional flags */
03608     while ( Optind < argc )
03609     {
03610       /* test flags */
03611       opt_str = argv[Optind];
03612       
03613       while (*opt_str)
03614       {
03615         switch( *opt_str )
03616         {
03617           case 'r':
03618           case 'R':
03619             flag_r ++;
03620             break;
03621             
03622           case 'w':
03623           case 'W':
03624             flag_w ++;
03625             break;
03626             
03627           case 'a':
03628           case 'A':
03629             flag_a ++;
03630             break;
03631 
03632           case 't':
03633           case 'T':
03634             flag_t ++;
03635             break;
03636           
03637           default:
03638             fprintf(output,"open_byname: unknown open flag : '%c'\n",*opt_str);
03639             err_flag ++;            
03640         }
03641         opt_str ++;
03642       }
03643       
03644       Optind++;
03645     }
03646         
03647   }
03648 
03649   
03650 
03651   if (err_flag){
03652     fprintf(output,help_open);
03653     return -1;
03654   }
03655 
03656   /* Convert filename to fsal_name_t */
03657   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_str2name(file,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,&filename))){
03658       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
03659       print_fsal_status(output,st);
03660       fprintf(output,"\n");
03661       return st.major;
03662     }
03663 
03664   
03665   /* make open flags */
03666   
03667   o_flags = 0;
03668   
03669   if (flag_r && flag_w ) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDWR ;
03670   else if (flag_r) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDONLY ;
03671   else if (flag_w) o_flags |= FSAL_O_WRONLY ;
03672   
03673   if (flag_a) o_flags |= FSAL_O_APPEND ;
03674   if (flag_t) o_flags |= FSAL_O_TRUNC ;
03675   
03676   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation on %s with flags %#X.\n",glob_path,
03677                       o_flags );
03678   
03679   st = FSAL_open_by_name( &(context->current_dir), &filename, &context->context, o_flags, &context->current_fd , NULL );
03680   
03681   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03682     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_open:");
03683     print_fsal_status(output,st);
03684     fprintf(output,"\n");
03685     return st.major;
03686   }
03687   
03688   /* note that a file is opened. */
03689   context->opened = TRUE;
03690   
03691   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation completed sucessfully : fd = %d.\n", FSAL_FILENO(&(context->current_fd)) );
03692     
03693   return 0;
03694   
03695 }
03696 
03697     
03702 int fn_fsal_open(
03703         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
03704         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
03705         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
03706       )
03707   {
03708   
03709   static char format[]="hv";
03710    
03711   static char help_open[]=
03712     "usage: open [-h][-v] <path> [<oflags>]\n"
03713     "   where <oflags> is a set of the following values:\n"
03714     "   'r': read, 'w': write, 'a': append, 't': truncate.\n";
03715 
03716   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
03717   fsal_handle_t filehdl;
03718   
03719   fsal_status_t st;
03720   
03721   int rc,option;
03722   int flag_v=0;
03723   int flag_h=0;
03724   int err_flag=0;
03725 
03726   fsal_openflags_t o_flags;
03727       
03728   int flag_r=0;
03729   int flag_w=0;
03730   int flag_a=0;
03731   int flag_t=0;
03732   
03733     
03734   char * file = NULL;
03735   char * opt_str;
03736     
03737   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
03738 
03739   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03740   if (!is_loaded){
03741     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
03742     return -1;
03743   }  
03744   
03745   /* initialize current thread */
03746     
03747   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
03748   
03749   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
03750   { 
03751     int rc;
03752     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
03753     if (rc != 0) return rc;
03754   }
03755   
03756   /* is a file already opened ? */
03757   if ( context->opened )
03758   {
03759     fprintf(output,"Error: a file is already opened. Use 'close' command first.\n");
03760     return -1;
03761   }
03762   
03763   /* analysing options */
03764   
03765   getopt_init();
03766   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03767     switch(option){
03768       case 'v':
03769         if (flag_v)
03770           fprintf(output,
03771               "open: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03772         else flag_v++;
03773         break;
03774       case 'h':
03775         if ( flag_h )
03776           fprintf(output,
03777               "open: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03778         else flag_h++;
03779         break;
03780       case '?':
03781         fprintf(output,"open: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03782         err_flag ++;
03783         break;
03784     }    
03785   }
03786   
03787   if (flag_h){
03788     fprintf(output,help_open);
03789     return 0;
03790   }
03791   
03792   /* one or two args expected */
03793   if ( Optind > (argc-1) )
03794     err_flag ++;
03795   else
03796   {
03797     file = argv[Optind];
03798     
03799     Optind++;
03800     
03801     /* optional flags */
03802     while ( Optind < argc )
03803     {
03804       /* test flags */
03805       opt_str = argv[Optind];
03806       
03807       while (*opt_str)
03808       {
03809         switch( *opt_str )
03810         {
03811           case 'r':
03812           case 'R':
03813             flag_r ++;
03814             break;
03815             
03816           case 'w':
03817           case 'W':
03818             flag_w ++;
03819             break;
03820             
03821           case 'a':
03822           case 'A':
03823             flag_a ++;
03824             break;
03825 
03826           case 't':
03827           case 'T':
03828             flag_t ++;
03829             break;
03830           
03831           default:
03832             fprintf(output,"open: unknown open flag : '%c'\n",*opt_str);
03833             err_flag ++;            
03834         }
03835         opt_str ++;
03836       }
03837       
03838       Optind++;
03839     }
03840         
03841   }
03842 
03843   if (err_flag){
03844     fprintf(output,help_open);
03845     return -1;
03846   }
03847     
03848   /* copy current path. */
03849   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03850   
03851   /* retrieves object handle*/
03852   if (rc = 
03853       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
03854                 file,context->current_dir,&filehdl,output))
03855     return rc;
03856 
03857   /* make open flags */
03858   
03859   o_flags = 0;
03860   
03861   if (flag_r && flag_w ) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDWR ;
03862   else if (flag_r) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDONLY ;
03863   else if (flag_w) o_flags |= FSAL_O_WRONLY ;
03864   
03865   if (flag_a) o_flags |= FSAL_O_APPEND ;
03866   if (flag_t) o_flags |= FSAL_O_TRUNC ;
03867   
03868   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation on %s with flags %#X.\n",glob_path,
03869                       o_flags );
03870   
03871   st = FSAL_open( &filehdl, &context->context, o_flags, &context->current_fd , NULL );
03872   
03873   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
03874     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_open:");
03875     print_fsal_status(output,st);
03876     fprintf(output,"\n");
03877     return st.major;
03878   }
03879   
03880   /* note that a file is opened. */
03881   context->opened = TRUE;
03882   
03883   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation completed sucessfully : fd = %d.\n", FSAL_FILENO(&(context->current_fd)) );
03884     
03885   return 0;
03886   
03887 }
03888 
03893 int fn_fsal_open_byfileid(
03894         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
03895         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
03896         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
03897       )
03898   {
03899   
03900   static char format[]="hv";
03901    
03902   static char help_open_byfileid[]=
03903     "usage: open_byfileid [-h][-v] <path> <fileid> [<oflags>]\n"
03904     "   where <oflags> is a set of the following values:\n"
03905     "   'r': read, 'w': write, 'a': append, 't': truncate.\n";
03906 
03907   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
03908   fsal_handle_t filehdl;
03909   
03910   fsal_status_t st;
03911   
03912   int rc,option;
03913   int flag_v=0;
03914   int flag_h=0;
03915   int err_flag=0;
03916 
03917   fsal_openflags_t o_flags;
03918       
03919   int flag_r=0;
03920   int flag_w=0;
03921   int flag_a=0;
03922   int flag_t=0;
03923   
03924     
03925   char * file = NULL;
03926   char * strfileid = NULL ;
03927   fsal_u64_t fileid = 0LL ;
03928   char * opt_str;
03929     
03930   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
03931 
03932   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03933   if (!is_loaded){
03934     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
03935     return -1;
03936   }  
03937   
03938   /* initialize current thread */
03939     
03940   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
03941   
03942   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
03943   { 
03944     int rc;
03945     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
03946     if (rc != 0) return rc;
03947   }
03948   
03949   /* is a file already opened ? */
03950   if ( context->opened )
03951   {
03952     fprintf(output,"Error: a file is already opened. Use 'close' command first.\n");
03953     return -1;
03954   }
03955   
03956   /* analysing options */
03957   
03958   getopt_init();
03959   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
03960     switch(option){
03961       case 'v':
03962         if (flag_v)
03963           fprintf(output,
03964               "open: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03965         else flag_v++;
03966         break;
03967       case 'h':
03968         if ( flag_h )
03969           fprintf(output,
03970               "open: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03971         else flag_h++;
03972         break;
03973       case '?':
03974         fprintf(output,"open: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03975         err_flag ++;
03976         break;
03977     }    
03978   }
03979   
03980   if (flag_h){
03981     fprintf(output,help_open_byfileid);
03982     return 0;
03983   }
03984   
03985   /* two or three args expected */
03986   if ( Optind > (argc-2) )
03987     err_flag ++;
03988   else
03989   {
03990     file = argv[Optind];
03991     strfileid = argv[Optind+1] ;
03992     sscanf( strfileid, "%llu", &fileid ) ;
03993  
03994     Optind += 2 ;
03995     
03996     /* optional flags */
03997     while ( Optind < argc )
03998     {
03999       /* test flags */
04000       opt_str = argv[Optind];
04001       
04002       while (*opt_str)
04003       {
04004         switch( *opt_str )
04005         {
04006           case 'r':
04007           case 'R':
04008             flag_r ++;
04009             break;
04010             
04011           case 'w':
04012           case 'W':
04013             flag_w ++;
04014             break;
04015             
04016           case 'a':
04017           case 'A':
04018             flag_a ++;
04019             break;
04020 
04021           case 't':
04022           case 'T':
04023             flag_t ++;
04024             break;
04025           
04026           default:
04027             fprintf(output,"open: unknown open flag : '%c'\n",*opt_str);
04028             err_flag ++;            
04029         }
04030         opt_str ++;
04031       }
04032       
04033       Optind++;
04034     }
04035         
04036   }
04037 
04038   if (err_flag){
04039     fprintf(output,help_open_byfileid);
04040     return -1;
04041   }
04042     
04043   /* copy current path. */
04044   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
04045   
04046   /* retrieves object handle*/
04047   if (rc = 
04048       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
04049                 file,context->current_dir,&filehdl,output))
04050     return rc;
04051 
04052   /* make open flags */
04053   
04054   o_flags = 0;
04055   
04056   if (flag_r && flag_w ) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDWR ;
04057   else if (flag_r) o_flags |= FSAL_O_RDONLY ;
04058   else if (flag_w) o_flags |= FSAL_O_WRONLY ;
04059   
04060   if (flag_a) o_flags |= FSAL_O_APPEND ;
04061   if (flag_t) o_flags |= FSAL_O_TRUNC ;
04062   
04063   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation on %s with flags %#X.\n",glob_path,
04064                       o_flags );
04065   
04066   st = FSAL_open_by_fileid( &filehdl, fileid, &context->context, o_flags, &context->current_fd , NULL );
04067   
04068   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
04069     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_open:");
04070     print_fsal_status(output,st);
04071     fprintf(output,"\n");
04072     return st.major;
04073   }
04074   
04075   /* note that a file is opened. */
04076   context->opened = TRUE;
04077   
04078   if (flag_v) fprintf(output,"Open operation completed sucessfully : fd = %d.\n", FSAL_FILENO(&(context->current_fd)) );
04079     
04080   return 0;
04081   
04082 }
04083 
04084 
04085 
04086 
04090 int fn_fsal_read(
04091         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
04092         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
04093         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
04094       )
04095 {
04096   
04097   static char format[]="hvAXB:s:";
04098    
04099   static char help_read[]=
04100    "Usage:\n"
04101    "  read [-h][-v][-A][-X] [-B <block_size> ] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  { <total_bytes> | all }\n"
04102    "Options:\n"
04103    "  -h: print this help\n"
04104    "  -v: verbose mode\n"
04105    "  -A: display read data in ascii\n"
04106    "  -X: display read data in hexa\n"
04107    "  -B <blocksize>: block size used for reading, in bytes (default 1k).\n"
04108    "  -s <seek_type>,<offset>: specify the position of the first byte to be read.\n"
04109    "        <seek_type> can take the values SET, CUR or END.\n"
04110    "        <offset> is a signed integer.\n"
04111    "  <total_bytes>: indicates the total number of bytes to be read\n"
04112    "      ('all' indicates that data are read until the end of the file).\n"
04113    "Example:\n"
04114    "  For reading the last 2kB of the opened file, using 1k block size:\n"
04115    "        read -B 1024 -s END,-2048 all   \n";
04116    
04117    
04118   fsal_status_t st;
04119   
04120   int rc,option;
04121   
04122   int flag_v=0;
04123   int flag_h=0;
04124   int flag_A=0;
04125   int flag_X=0;
04126   int flag_B=0;
04127   int flag_s=0;
04128   
04129   int err_flag=0;
04130 
04131   char * str_block_size = NULL;
04132   
04133   char str_seek_buff[256];
04134       
04135   char * str_seek_type = NULL;
04136   char * str_seek_offset = NULL;
04137   char * str_total_bytes = NULL;
04138   
04139   fsal_size_t block_size = 1024;  /* default: 1ko */  
04140   fsal_size_t total_bytes = 0; /* 0 == read all */
04141   fsal_seek_t seek_desc =
04142       { FSAL_SEEK_CUR, 0 }; /* default: read current position */
04143   
04144   fsal_seek_t * p_seek_desc = NULL;
04145   
04146   /* fsal arguments */
04147   
04148   fsal_boolean_t  is_eof = 0;
04149   fsal_size_t     total_nb_read = 0;
04150   fsal_size_t     once_nb_read = 0;
04151   fsal_size_t     nb_block_read = 0;
04152   
04153   char * p_read_buff;
04154   
04155   
04156   struct timeval timer_start;
04157   struct timeval timer_stop;
04158   struct timeval timer_diff;
04159   
04160     
04161   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
04162 
04163   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04164   if (!is_loaded){
04165     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
04166     return -1;
04167   }  
04168   
04169   /* initialize current thread */
04170     
04171   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
04172   
04173   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
04174   { 
04175     int rc;
04176     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
04177     if (rc != 0) return rc;
04178   }
04179   
04180   /* is a file opened ? */
04181   if ( !context->opened )
04182   {
04183     fprintf(output,"Error: no opened file. Use 'open' command first.\n");
04184     return -1;
04185   }
04186     
04187   /* option analysis. */
04188   
04189   getopt_init();
04190   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
04191     switch(option){
04192       
04193       case 'v':
04194         if (flag_v)
04195           fprintf(output,
04196               "read: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
04197         else flag_v++;
04198         break;
04199         
04200       case 'h':
04201         if ( flag_h )
04202           fprintf(output,
04203               "read: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
04204         else flag_h++;
04205         break;
04206         
04207       case 'A':
04208         if ( flag_A )
04209           fprintf(output,
04210               "read: warning: option 'A' has been specified more than once.\n");
04211         else if ( flag_X )
04212         {
04213           fprintf(output,
04214               "read: option 'A' conflicts with option 'X'.\n");
04215           err_flag ++;
04216         }
04217         else flag_A++;
04218         break;
04219         
04220       case 'X':
04221         if ( flag_X )
04222           fprintf(output,
04223               "read: warning: option 'X' has been specified more than once.\n");
04224         else if ( flag_A )
04225         {
04226           fprintf(output,
04227               "read: option 'X' conflicts with option 'A'.\n");
04228           err_flag ++;
04229         }
04230         else flag_X++;
04231         break;
04232         
04233       case 'B':
04234         if ( flag_B )
04235           fprintf(output,
04236               "read: warning: option 'B' has been specified more than once.\n");
04237         else
04238         {
04239           flag_B++;
04240           str_block_size = Optarg;
04241         }
04242         break;
04243         
04244       case 's':
04245         if ( flag_s )
04246           fprintf(output,
04247               "read: warning: option 's' has been specified more than once.\n");
04248         else
04249         {
04250           flag_s++;
04251           strncpy(str_seek_buff,Optarg,256);
04252           str_seek_type = str_seek_buff;
04253         }
04254         break;
04255         
04256       case '?':
04257         fprintf(output,"read: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
04258         err_flag ++;
04259         break;
04260     }    
04261   }
04262   
04263   if (flag_h)
04264   {
04265     fprintf(output,help_read);
04266     return 0;
04267   }
04268   
04269   /* Exactly one arg expected */
04270   
04271   if (Optind != (argc-1))
04272     err_flag ++;
04273   else
04274     str_total_bytes = argv[Optind];
04275   
04276   if (err_flag)
04277   {
04278     fprintf(output,help_read);
04279     return -1;
04280   }
04281   
04282   /* check argument types */
04283     
04284   if ( flag_B )
04285   {
04286     /* Try to convert the str_block_size to fsal_size_t */
04287     
04288     rc = ato64( str_block_size, &block_size );
04289     
04290     if ( rc == -1 )
04291     {
04292       fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid block size \"%s\"\n",
04293           str_block_size);
04294       err_flag++;
04295     }
04296     
04297   }
04298   
04299   if ( flag_s )
04300   {
04301     /* Try to parse the argument */
04302     
04303     str_seek_offset = strchr( str_seek_type, ',' );
04304     
04305     if ( str_seek_offset == NULL )
04306     {
04307       fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid seek specifier \"%s\". <seek_type>,<offset> expected.\n",
04308           str_seek_type);
04309       err_flag++;      
04310     }
04311     
04312     if ( !err_flag )
04313     {
04314       int sign = 1;
04315       
04316       *str_seek_offset='\0';
04317       str_seek_offset++; /* the first char after the "," */
04318 
04319       /* Check seek type */
04320 
04321       if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "CUR", 256 ) )
04322         seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_CUR;
04323       else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "SET", 256 ) )
04324         seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET;
04325       else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "END", 256 ) )
04326         seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_END;
04327       else
04328       {
04329         fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid seek type \"%s\". CUR, SET or END expected.\n",
04330             str_seek_type);
04331         err_flag ++;
04332       }
04333       
04334       /* Try to convert str_seek_offset to fsal_off_t */
04335       
04336       switch (str_seek_offset[0])
04337       {
04338         case '+':
04339           sign = 1;
04340           str_seek_offset ++;
04341           break;
04342           
04343         case '-':
04344           sign = -1;
04345           str_seek_offset ++;
04346           break;
04347       }
04348       
04349       rc = ato64( str_seek_offset, (unsigned long long *) &seek_desc.offset );
04350 
04351       if ( rc == -1 )
04352       {
04353         fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid offset \"%s\".\n",
04354             str_seek_offset);
04355         err_flag++;
04356       }
04357       else
04358          if (sign < 0) seek_desc.offset = -seek_desc.offset;
04359      
04360     }
04361     
04362     p_seek_desc = &seek_desc;
04363     
04364   }
04365   else  
04366   {
04367     p_seek_desc = NULL; /* default seeking */
04368   }
04369   
04370   if (!strcasecmp( str_total_bytes , "all" ))
04371   {
04372     total_bytes = 0;
04373   }
04374   else
04375   {
04376     rc = ato64( str_total_bytes, &total_bytes );
04377     
04378     if ( rc == -1 )
04379     {
04380       fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid read size \"%s\". \"all\" or <nb_bytes> expected.\n",
04381           str_total_bytes);
04382       err_flag++;
04383     }
04384   }
04385 
04386   if (err_flag)
04387   {
04388     fprintf(output,help_read);
04389     return -1;
04390   }
04391     
04392   if (flag_v)
04393   {
04394         
04395     /* print a sum-up of read parameters */
04396     fprintf(output, "Read options: Block size: %llu Bytes, Seek: %s%+lld, Read limit: %llu Bytes\n",
04397         block_size,
04398         ( p_seek_desc ? ( seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_SET ? "SET":
04399           seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_CUR ? "CUR":
04400           "END" ) : "DEFAULT" ),
04401         (long long)( p_seek_desc ? seek_desc.offset : 0LL ),
04402         total_bytes );
04403   }
04404   
04405   
04406   /* Now all arguments have been parsed, let's act ! */
04407   
04408   /* alloc a buffer */
04409   p_read_buff = Mem_Alloc( block_size );
04410   
04411   if ( p_read_buff == NULL )
04412   {
04413     fprintf(output,"read: error: Not enough memory to allocate read buffer (%llu Bytes).\n",block_size);
04414     return ENOMEM;    
04415   }
04416   
04417   
04418   gettimeofday( &timer_start,NULL );  
04419   
04420   /* while EOF is not reached, and read<asked (when total_bytes!=0) */
04421   while ( !is_eof && !(( total_bytes!= 0) && (total_nb_read >= total_bytes)) )
04422   {
04423     
04424     st = FSAL_read( &context->current_fd, p_seek_desc,
04425                     block_size, (caddr_t)p_read_buff, &once_nb_read, &is_eof );
04426      
04427     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
04428     {
04429       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_read:");
04430       print_fsal_status(output,st);
04431       fprintf(output,"\n");
04432       
04433       /* exit only if it is not retryable */
04434       if ( fsal_is_retryable(st) )
04435       {
04436         sleep(1);
04437         continue;
04438       }
04439       else
04440       {
04441         Mem_Free(p_read_buff);
04442         return st.major;
04443       }
04444     }
04445     
04446     /* print what was read. */
04447     if ( flag_A )
04448     {
04449       fsal_size_t index;
04450       for (index=0; index<once_nb_read; index ++)
04451         fprintf( output, "%c.", p_read_buff[index] );
04452     }
04453     else if ( flag_X )
04454     {
04455       fsal_size_t index;
04456       for (index=0; index<once_nb_read; index ++)
04457         fprintf( output, "%.2X ", p_read_buff[index] );      
04458     }
04459     else
04460         fprintf( output,"." );
04461 
04462     /* update stats */    
04463     
04464     if (once_nb_read>0) nb_block_read ++;
04465     
04466     total_nb_read += once_nb_read;
04467     
04468     /* flush */
04469     if ( nb_block_read % 10 ) fflush( output );
04470     
04471     /* what ever seek type was, we continue reading from current position */
04472     p_seek_desc = NULL;
04473     
04474   }
04475   
04476   gettimeofday( &timer_stop,NULL );
04477   
04478   /* newline after read blocks */
04479   fprintf( output,"\n" );  
04480   
04481   if (flag_v)
04482   {
04483     double bandwidth ;
04484     
04485     /* print stats */
04486     fprintf(output, "Nb blocks read: %llu\n", nb_block_read);
04487     fprintf(output, "Total: %llu Bytes\n", total_nb_read );
04488     
04489     fprintf(output, "Time enlapsed: ");
04490     timer_diff = time_diff( timer_start, timer_stop );
04491     print_timeval( output, timer_diff );
04492     
04493     bandwidth = total_nb_read/(1024*1024*( timer_diff.tv_sec + 0.000001 * timer_diff.tv_usec ));
04494         
04495     fprintf(output, "Bandwidth: %f MB/s\n", bandwidth );
04496     
04497   }
04498   Mem_Free(p_read_buff);
04499   
04500   return 0;
04501 }
04502 
04503 
04504 
04534 int fn_fsal_write(
04535         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
04536         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
04537         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
04538       )
04539 {
04540   
04541   static char format[]="hvs:N:A:X:";
04542    
04543   static char help_write[]=
04544           "Usage:\n"
04545           "  write [-h][-v] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  [-N <nb_times>] -A <ascii_string>\n"
04546           "  write [-h][-v] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  [-N <nb_times>] -X <hexa_data>\n"
04547           "Where:\n"
04548           "  <seek_type> can be: SET, CUR, END\n"
04549           "  <offset> is a signed number of bytes.\n"
04550           "  <nb_times> is the number of times we write the expression into the file.\n"
04551           "\n"
04552           "  <ascii_string> is a string to be written to file.\n"
04553           "      Note that the null terminating character of is also written\n"
04554           "      to file.\n"
04555           "or\n"
04556           "  <hexa_data> is a data represented in hexadecimal format,\n"
04557           "      that is to be written to file.\n"
04558           "\n"
04559           "Examples:\n"
04560           "\n"
04561           "  For writting 10 times the null terminated string \"hello world\"\n"
04562           "  at the end of the file:\n"
04563           "        write -s END,0 -N 10 -A \"hello world\"\n"
04564           "\n"
04565           "  For overwritting the beginning of the file with\n"
04566           "  the pattern 0xA1267AEF31254ADE repeated twice:\n"
04567           "        write -s SET,0 -N 2 -X \"A1267AEF31254ADE\"\n";
04568       
04569   fsal_status_t st;
04570   
04571   int rc,option;
04572   
04573   int flag_v=0;
04574   int flag_h=0;
04575   int flag_N=0;
04576   int flag_s=0;
04577   int flag_A=0;
04578   int flag_X=0;
04579   
04580   int err_flag = 0;
04581 
04582   char * str_times = NULL;
04583   char str_seek_buff[256];      
04584   char * str_seek_type = NULL;
04585   char * str_seek_offset = NULL;  
04586   
04587   char * str_hexa = NULL;  
04588   char * str_ascii = NULL;
04589   
04590   size_t datasize = 0;
04591   char * databuff = NULL;
04592   
04593   unsigned long long nb_times=1; /* default = 1 */  
04594   
04595   fsal_size_t block_size;  /* the length of the data block to be written */
04596   
04597   fsal_u64_t  nb_block_written=0;
04598   fsal_size_t size_written=0;
04599   fsal_size_t size_written_once=0;
04600   
04601   fsal_seek_t seek_desc =
04602       { FSAL_SEEK_CUR, 0 }; /* default: write to current position */
04603   
04604   fsal_seek_t * p_seek_desc = NULL;
04605 
04606   struct timeval timer_start;
04607   struct timeval timer_stop;
04608   struct timeval timer_diff;
04609   
04610     
04611   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
04612 
04613   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04614   if (!is_loaded){
04615     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
04616     return -1;
04617   }  
04618   
04619   /* initialize current thread */
04620     
04621   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
04622   
04623   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
04624   { 
04625     int rc;
04626     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
04627     if (rc != 0) return rc;
04628   }
04629   
04630   /* is a file opened ? */
04631   if ( !context->opened )
04632   {
04633     fprintf(output,"Error: no opened file. Use 'open' command first.\n");
04634     return -1;
04635   }
04636     
04637   /* option analysis. */
04638   
04639   getopt_init();
04640   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
04641     switch(option){
04642       
04643       case 'v':
04644         if (flag_v)
04645           fprintf(output,
04646               "write: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
04647         else flag_v++;
04648         break;
04649         
04650       case 'h':
04651         if ( flag_h )
04652           fprintf(output,
04653               "write: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
04654         else flag_h++;
04655         break;
04656         
04657       case 'N':
04658         if ( flag_N )
04659           fprintf(output,
04660               "write: warning: option 'N' has been specified more than once.\n");
04661         else
04662         {
04663           flag_N++;
04664           str_times = Optarg;
04665         }
04666         break;
04667         
04668       case 's':
04669         if ( flag_s )
04670           fprintf(output,
04671               "write: warning: option 's' has been specified more than once.\n");
04672         else
04673         {
04674           flag_s++;
04675           strncpy(str_seek_buff,Optarg,256);
04676           str_seek_type = str_seek_buff;
04677         }
04678         break;
04679         
04680       case 'A':
04681         if ( flag_A )
04682           fprintf(output,
04683               "write: warning: option 'A' has been specified more than once.\n");
04684         else if ( flag_X )
04685         {
04686           fprintf(output,
04687               "write: option 'A' conflicts with option 'X'.\n");
04688           err_flag ++;
04689         }
04690         else
04691         {
04692           flag_A++;
04693           str_ascii = Optarg;
04694         }
04695         break;
04696         
04697       case 'X':
04698         if ( flag_X )
04699           fprintf(output,
04700               "write: warning: option 'X' has been specified more than once.\n");
04701         else if ( flag_A )
04702         {
04703           fprintf(output,
04704               "write: option 'X' conflicts with option 'A'.\n");
04705           err_flag ++;
04706         }
04707         else
04708         {
04709           flag_X++;
04710           str_hexa = Optarg;
04711         }
04712         break;
04713         
04714       case '?':
04715         fprintf(output,"write: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
04716         err_flag ++;
04717         break;
04718     }    
04719   }
04720   
04721   if (flag_h)
04722   {
04723     fprintf(output,help_write);
04724     return 0;
04725   }
04726   
04727   /* No extra arg expected */
04728   
04729   if (Optind != argc) err_flag ++;
04730 
04731   if (!flag_A && !flag_X)
04732   {
04733     fprintf(output, "write: error: -A or -X option is mandatory.\n");
04734     err_flag ++;
04735   }
04736 
04737     
04738   if (err_flag)
04739   {
04740     fprintf(output,help_write);
04741     return -1;
04742   }
04743   
04744   /* check argument types */
04745     
04746   if ( flag_N )
04747   {
04748     /* Try to convert the str_times to nb_times */
04749     
04750     rc = ato64( str_times, &nb_times );
04751     
04752     if ( rc == -1 )
04753     {
04754       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid number \"%s\"\n",
04755           str_times);
04756       return EINVAL;
04757     }
04758     
04759   }
04760   
04761   if ( flag_s )
04762   {
04763     int sign = 1;
04764 
04765     /* Try to parse the argument */
04766     
04767     str_seek_offset = strchr( str_seek_type, ',' );
04768     
04769     if ( str_seek_offset == NULL )
04770     {
04771       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid seek specifier \"%s\". <seek_type>,<offset> expected.\n",
04772           str_seek_type);
04773       return EINVAL;
04774     }
04775     
04776     *str_seek_offset='\0';
04777     str_seek_offset++; /* the first char after the "," */
04778 
04779     /* Check seek type */
04780 
04781     if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "CUR", 256 ) )
04782       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_CUR;
04783     else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "SET", 256 ) )
04784       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET;
04785     else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "END", 256 ) )
04786       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_END;
04787     else
04788     {
04789       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid seek type \"%s\". CUR, SET or END expected.\n",
04790           str_seek_type);
04791       return EINVAL;
04792     }
04793 
04794     /* Try to convert str_seek_offset to fsal_off_t */
04795 
04796     switch (str_seek_offset[0])
04797     {
04798       case '+':
04799         sign = 1;
04800         str_seek_offset ++;
04801         break;
04802 
04803       case '-':
04804         sign = -1;
04805         str_seek_offset ++;
04806         break;
04807     }
04808 
04809     rc = ato64( str_seek_offset,  (unsigned long long *) &seek_desc.offset );
04810 
04811     if ( rc == -1 )
04812     {
04813       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid offset \"%s\".\n",
04814           str_seek_offset);
04815       return EINVAL;
04816     }
04817     else
04818        if (sign < 0) seek_desc.offset = -seek_desc.offset;
04819 
04820     
04821     p_seek_desc = &seek_desc;
04822     
04823   }
04824   else  
04825   {
04826     p_seek_desc = NULL; /* default seeking */
04827   }
04828   
04829   if (flag_A)
04830   {
04831     datasize = strlen(str_ascii)+1; /* Include null termination char. */
04832     databuff = str_ascii;    
04833   }
04834   
04835   
04836   if (flag_X)
04837   {
04838     size_t length = strlen( str_hexa );
04839     
04840     datasize = (length >> 1);
04841     
04842     if ( length % 2 )
04843     {
04844     
04845       /* if it is not odd: error */
04846       fprintf(output,"write: error: in \"%s\", data length is not a multiple of 8 bits.\n",
04847             str_hexa);
04848     
04849       return EINVAL;
04850     }
04851     
04852     databuff = Mem_Alloc( datasize + 1 );
04853     
04854     if ( databuff == NULL )
04855     {
04856       fprintf(output,"write: error: Not enough memory to allocate %llu Bytes.\n",
04857             (unsigned long long)datasize);
04858       return ENOMEM;
04859     }
04860 
04861     
04862     memset( databuff, 0, datasize + 1 );
04863       
04864     /* try to convert the string to hexa */
04865     rc = sscanmem(databuff, datasize, str_hexa );
04866 
04867     if (rc != (int)(2*datasize))
04868     {
04869       /* if it is not odd: error */
04870       fprintf(output,"write: error: \"%s\" in not a valid hexa format.\n",
04871             str_hexa);
04872 
04873       Mem_Free( str_hexa );
04874 
04875       return EINVAL;        
04876     }
04877     
04878   }
04879     
04880   
04881   if (flag_v)
04882   {    
04883     /* print a sum-up of write parameters */
04884     fprintf(output, "Write options: Data length: %llu x %llu Bytes, Seek: %s%+lld\n",
04885         (unsigned long long)nb_times,
04886         (unsigned long long)datasize,
04887         ( p_seek_desc ? ( seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_SET ? "SET":
04888           seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_CUR ? "CUR":
04889           "END" ) : "DEFAULT" ),
04890         ( p_seek_desc ? seek_desc.offset : 0LL )
04891         );
04892   }
04893   
04894   /* variables initialisation */
04895     
04896   block_size = (fsal_size_t) datasize;  
04897   nb_block_written=0;
04898   size_written=0;  
04899   size_written_once=0;
04900   
04901   gettimeofday( &timer_start,NULL );  
04902   
04903   /* write loop */
04904     
04905   while ( nb_block_written < nb_times )
04906   {
04907     
04908     st = FSAL_write( &context->current_fd, p_seek_desc,
04909                      block_size, (caddr_t)databuff, &size_written_once );
04910      
04911     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
04912     {
04913       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_write:");
04914       print_fsal_status(output,st);
04915       fprintf(output,"\n");
04916       
04917       /* exit only if it is not retryable */      
04918       if ( fsal_is_retryable(st) )
04919       {
04920         sleep(1);
04921         continue;
04922       }
04923       else
04924       {
04925         if (flag_X) Mem_Free( databuff );
04926         return st.major;
04927       }
04928     }
04929     
04930     fprintf( output,"." );
04931 
04932     /* update stats */
04933     
04934     if (size_written_once>0) nb_block_written ++;
04935     
04936     size_written += size_written_once;
04937     
04938     /* flush */
04939     if ( nb_block_written % 10 ) fflush( output );
04940 
04941     
04942     /* what ever seek type was, we continue writting to the current position */
04943     p_seek_desc = NULL;
04944     
04945   }
04946   
04947   gettimeofday( &timer_stop,NULL );
04948   
04949   /* newline after written blocks */
04950   fprintf( output,"\n" );  
04951   
04952   if (flag_v)
04953   {
04954     double bandwidth ;
04955     
04956     /* print stats */
04957     fprintf(output, "Nb blocks written: %llu\n", nb_block_written);
04958     fprintf(output, "Total volume: %llu Bytes\n", size_written );
04959     
04960     fprintf(output, "Time enlapsed: ");
04961     timer_diff = time_diff( timer_start, timer_stop );
04962     print_timeval( output, timer_diff );
04963     
04964     bandwidth = size_written/(1024*1024*( timer_diff.tv_sec + 0.000001 * timer_diff.tv_usec ));
04965     
04966     fprintf(output, "Bandwidth: %f MB/s\n", bandwidth );
04967     
04968   }
04969   
04970   if (flag_X) Mem_Free( databuff );
04971   
04972   return 0;
04973   
04974 }
04975 
04976 
04977 
04978 
04983 int fn_fsal_close(
04984         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
04985         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
04986         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
04987       )
04988   {
04989   
04990   static char help_close[]= "usage: close\n";
04991 
04992   fsal_status_t st;
04993   
04994   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
04995 
04996   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04997   if (!is_loaded){
04998     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
04999     return -1;
05000   }  
05001   
05002   /* initialize current thread */
05003     
05004   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05005   
05006   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05007   { 
05008     int rc;
05009     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05010     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05011   }
05012   
05013   /* is a file already opened ? */
05014   if ( !context->opened )
05015   {
05016     fprintf(output,"Error: this is no file currently opened.\n");
05017     return -1;
05018   }
05019   
05020   if ( argc != 1 )
05021   {
05022     fprintf(output,help_close);
05023     return -1;    
05024   }  
05025   
05026   
05027   st = FSAL_close( &context->current_fd );
05028   
05029   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
05030     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_close:");
05031     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05032     fprintf(output,"\n");
05033     return st.major;
05034   }
05035   
05036   /* note that a file is closed. */
05037   context->opened = FALSE;
05038   
05039   return 0;
05040   
05041 }
05042 
05047 int fn_fsal_close_byfileid(
05048         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
05049         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
05050         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
05051       )
05052   {
05053   
05054   static char help_close[]= "usage: close_byfileid <fileid>\n";
05055 
05056   fsal_status_t st;
05057   
05058   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
05059 
05060   /* is the fs initialized ? */
05061   if (!is_loaded){
05062     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
05063     return -1;
05064   }  
05065   
05066   /* initialize current thread */
05067     
05068   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05069   
05070   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05071   { 
05072     int rc;
05073     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05074     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05075   }
05076   
05077   /* is a file already opened ? */
05078   if ( !context->opened )
05079   {
05080     fprintf(output,"Error: this is no file currently opened.\n");
05081     return -1;
05082   }
05083   
05084   if ( argc != 1 )
05085   {
05086     fprintf(output,help_close);
05087     return -1;    
05088   }  
05089   
05090   
05091   st = FSAL_close( &context->current_fd );
05092   
05093   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
05094     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_close:");
05095     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05096     fprintf(output,"\n");
05097     return st.major;
05098   }
05099   
05100   /* note that a file is closed. */
05101   context->opened = FALSE;
05102   
05103   return 0;
05104   
05105 }
05106 
05107 
05112 int fn_fsal_cat(
05113         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
05114         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
05115         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
05116       )
05117   {
05118   
05119   static char format[]="hf";
05120    
05121   static char help_cat[]=
05122     "usage: cat [-h][-f] <path>\n"
05123     "   -h: print this help\n"
05124     "   -f: by default, cat doesn't print more that 1MB.\n"
05125     "       this option force it to print the whole file.\n";
05126 
05127   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
05128   fsal_handle_t filehdl;
05129   
05130   fsal_status_t st;
05131   
05132   int rc,option;
05133   int flag_h=0;
05134   int flag_f=0;
05135   int err_flag=0;
05136 
05137   fsal_openflags_t o_flags;
05138   fsal_file_t      cat_fd;
05139   
05140 #define MAX_CAT_SIZE  (1024*1024)
05141   fsal_size_t nb_read = 0;
05142   fsal_size_t buffsize = 1024;
05143   char        readbuff[1024];  
05144   int is_eof = 0;
05145         
05146   char * file = NULL;
05147     
05148   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
05149 
05150   /* is the fs initialized ? */
05151   if (!is_loaded){
05152     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
05153     return -1;
05154   }  
05155   
05156   /* initialize current thread */
05157     
05158   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05159   
05160   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05161   { 
05162     int rc;
05163     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05164     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05165   }
05166   
05167   /* analysing options */
05168   
05169   getopt_init();
05170   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
05171     switch(option){
05172       case 'f':
05173         if (flag_f)
05174           fprintf(output,
05175               "cat: warning: option 'f' has been specified more than once.\n");
05176         else flag_f++;
05177         break;
05178       case 'h':
05179         if ( flag_h )
05180           fprintf(output,
05181               "cat: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
05182         else flag_h++;
05183         break;
05184       case '?':
05185         fprintf(output,"cat: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
05186         err_flag ++;
05187         break;
05188     }    
05189   }
05190   
05191   if (flag_h){
05192     fprintf(output,help_cat);
05193     return 0;
05194   }
05195   
05196   /* one arg expected */
05197   if ( Optind != (argc-1) )
05198     err_flag ++;
05199   else
05200     file = argv[Optind];        
05201 
05202   if (err_flag){
05203     fprintf(output,help_cat);
05204     return -1;
05205   }
05206     
05207   /* copy current path. */
05208   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05209   
05210   /* retrieves object handle*/
05211   if (rc = 
05212       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
05213                 file,context->current_dir,&filehdl,output))
05214     return rc;
05215 
05216   /* make open flags */
05217   
05218   o_flags = FSAL_O_RDONLY;
05219   
05220   st = FSAL_open( &filehdl, &context->context, o_flags, &cat_fd , NULL );
05221   
05222   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
05223     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_open:");
05224     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05225     fprintf(output,"\n");
05226     return st.major;
05227   }
05228   
05229   /* read operations */
05230   
05231   while (!is_eof && ( flag_f || ( nb_read < MAX_CAT_SIZE ) ) )
05232   {
05233     fsal_size_t nb_read_once;
05234     
05235     st = FSAL_read( &cat_fd, NULL, buffsize, (caddr_t)readbuff,
05236                     &nb_read_once, &is_eof );
05237         
05238     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
05239     {
05240       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_read:");
05241       print_fsal_status(output,st);
05242       fprintf(output,"\n");
05243       
05244       /* exit only if it is not retryable */
05245       if ( fsal_is_retryable(st) )
05246       {
05247         sleep(1);
05248         continue;
05249       }
05250       else return st.major;
05251     }
05252     
05253     fwrite( (caddr_t)readbuff, (size_t)nb_read_once, 1, output );
05254 
05255     /* update stats */    
05256     nb_read += nb_read_once;    
05257       
05258   }
05259   
05260   FSAL_close( &cat_fd );
05261   
05262   if (!is_eof)
05263   {
05264     fprintf( output, "\n----------------- File is larger than 1MB (use -f option to display all) -----------------\n");
05265     return EPERM;
05266   }    
05267     
05268   return 0;
05269   
05270 }
05271 
05272 
05273 
05278 int fn_fsal_rcp(
05279         int argc ,                /* IN : number of args in argv */
05280         char ** argv ,            /* IN : arg list               */
05281         FILE * output             /* IN : output stream          */
05282       )
05283   {
05284   
05285   static char format[]="hvrw";
05286    
05287   static char help_rcp[]=
05288     "usage: rcp [-h][-v] -r|-w <fsal_path> <local_path>\n"
05289     "  -h : print this help\n"
05290     "  -v : verbose mode\n"
05291     "copy direction:\n"
05292     "  -r : FSAL -> local filesystem\n"
05293     "  -w : local filesystem -> FSAL\n";
05294 
05295   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
05296   fsal_handle_t filehdl;
05297   
05298   fsal_status_t st;
05299   
05300   int rc,option;
05301   int flag_h=0;
05302   int flag_v=0;
05303   int flag_r=0;
05304   int flag_w=0;
05305   
05306   int err_flag=0;
05307   
05308   char * local_file = NULL;
05309   char * fsal_file = NULL;
05310   
05311   fsal_path_t local_path_fsal;
05312   fsal_rcpflag_t  rcp_opt;
05313   
05314   
05315   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
05316 
05317   /* is the fs initialized ? */
05318   if (!is_loaded){
05319     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
05320     return -1;
05321   }  
05322   
05323   /* initialize current thread */
05324     
05325   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05326   
05327   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05328   { 
05329     int rc;
05330     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05331     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05332   }
05333   
05334   /* analysing options */
05335   
05336   getopt_init();
05337   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){   
05338     switch(option){
05339       case 'r':
05340         if (flag_w)
05341         {
05342           fprintf(output,
05343               "rcp: error: option 'r' conflicts with option 'w'.\n");
05344           err_flag ++;
05345         }
05346         else if (flag_r)
05347           fprintf(output,
05348               "rcp: warning: option 'r' has been specified more than once.\n");
05349         else flag_r++;
05350         break;
05351       case 'w':
05352         if (flag_r)
05353         {
05354           fprintf(output,
05355               "rcp: error: option 'w' conflicts with option 'r'.\n");
05356           err_flag ++;
05357         }
05358         else if (flag_w)
05359           fprintf(output,
05360               "rcp: warning: option 'w' has been specified more than once.\n");
05361         else flag_w++;
05362         break;
05363       case 'h':
05364         if ( flag_h )
05365           fprintf(output,
05366               "rcp: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
05367         else flag_h++;
05368         break;
05369       case 'v':
05370         if ( flag_v )
05371           fprintf(output,
05372               "rcp: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
05373         else flag_v++;
05374         break;
05375       case '?':
05376         fprintf(output,"rcp: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
05377         err_flag ++;
05378         break;
05379     }    
05380   }
05381   
05382   if (flag_h){
05383     fprintf(output,help_rcp);
05384     return 0;
05385   }
05386   
05387   /* two args expected */
05388   if ( Optind != (argc-2) )
05389     err_flag ++;
05390   else
05391   {
05392     fsal_file = argv[Optind]; 
05393     local_file = argv[Optind+1];
05394   }
05395   
05396   if (err_flag){
05397     fprintf(output,help_rcp);
05398     return -1;
05399   }
05400     
05401   /* copy current path. */
05402   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05403   
05404   /* retrieves object handle*/
05405   
05406   if (rc = 
05407       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
05408                 fsal_file,context->current_dir,&filehdl,output))
05409     return rc;
05410 
05411   
05412   /* build fsal path strcuture for local file */
05413   
05414   st = FSAL_str2path( local_file, strlen(local_file)+1,
05415                       &local_path_fsal );
05416   
05417   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){
05418     
05419     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2path:");
05420     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05421     fprintf(output,"\n");
05422     return st.major;
05423     
05424   }
05425 
05426     
05427   /* make rcp flags */
05428   
05429   if ( flag_r )
05430     rcp_opt = FSAL_RCP_FS_TO_LOCAL | FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_CREAT ;
05431   else
05432     rcp_opt = FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ;
05433 
05434   if ( flag_v )
05435   {
05436     fprintf(output, "rcp: calling FSAL_rcp with options: ");
05437     
05438     if ( rcp_opt & FSAL_RCP_FS_TO_LOCAL )
05439       fprintf(output, "FSAL_RCP_FS_TO_LOCAL ");
05440     
05441     if ( rcp_opt & FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS )
05442       fprintf(output, "FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ");
05443     
05444     if ( rcp_opt & FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_EXCL )
05445       fprintf(output, "FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_EXCL ");
05446     
05447     if ( rcp_opt & FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_CREAT )
05448       fprintf(output, "FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_CREAT ");
05449     
05450     fprintf(output,"\n");
05451   }
05452   
05453   
05454   /* rcp operation */
05455   
05456   st = FSAL_rcp( &filehdl, &context->context, &local_path_fsal ,rcp_opt );
05457   
05458   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) ){
05459     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_rcp:");
05460     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05461     fprintf(output,"\n");
05462     return st.major;
05463   }
05464   
05465   if ( flag_v )
05466   {
05467     if ( flag_r )
05468       fprintf(output, "rcp operation successfully completed : %s -> %s\n",glob_path, local_file );
05469     else
05470       fprintf(output, "rcp operation successfully completed : %s -> %s\n",local_file, glob_path );      
05471   }
05472     
05473   return 0;
05474   
05475 }
05476 
05477 
05478 
05479 
05481 int fn_fsal_cross( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
05482         char ** argv ,        /* IN : arg list               */
05483         FILE * output         /* IN : output stream          */
05484       ){
05485 
05486   
05487   static char help_cross[]=
05488   "usage: cross <junction_path>\n";
05489 
05490   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
05491   fsal_handle_t junction_hdl, root_hdl;
05492   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
05493   fsal_status_t st;
05494   int rc;
05495     
05496   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
05497 
05498   /* is the fs initialized ? */
05499   if (!is_loaded){
05500     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
05501     return -1;
05502   }
05503   
05504   
05505   /* initialize current thread */
05506     
05507   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05508   
05509   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05510   { 
05511     int rc;
05512     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05513     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05514   }
05515   
05516   /* Exactly one arg expected */
05517   if (argc!=2){
05518     fprintf(output,help_cross);
05519     return -1;
05520   }
05521   
05522   /* is it a relative or absolute path. */
05523   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05524   
05525   if (rc = 
05526       solvepath(glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
05527                 argv[1],context->current_dir,&junction_hdl,output))
05528     return rc;
05529 
05530   /* solves the junction */
05531   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes );
05532   FSAL_SET_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes,
05533       FSAL_ATTR_TYPE
05534       | FSAL_ATTR_MODE
05535       | FSAL_ATTR_GROUP
05536       | FSAL_ATTR_OWNER
05537       );
05538   
05539   st = FSAL_lookupJunction( &junction_hdl,
05540                             &context->context,
05541                             &root_hdl,
05542                             NULL );
05543   
05544   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) ){
05545     char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
05546     snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&junction_hdl);
05547     
05548     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_lookupJunction(@%s):",buff);
05549     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05550     fprintf(output,"\n");
05551     return st.major;
05552   }
05553   
05554   /* Apply changes */
05555   strncat( glob_path,">",FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
05556   strncpy(context->current_path,glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05557   context->current_dir = root_hdl;
05558     
05559   {
05560   char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
05561   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&context->current_dir);
05562   
05563   fprintf(output,"Current directory is \"%s\" (@%s)\n",
05564     context->current_path,buff);
05565   }
05566    
05567   return 0;
05568       
05569 }
05570 
05571 
05573 int fn_fsal_handlecmp( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
05574                        char ** argv ,         /* IN : arg list   */
05575                        FILE * output          /* IN : output stream */
05576                       )
05577 {
05578   static char help_handlecmp[]=
05579   "usage: handlecmp <obj1> <obj2>\n";
05580 
05581   char glob_path1[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
05582   char glob_path2[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
05583   char buff[2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1];
05584   
05585   fsal_handle_t hdl1, hdl2;
05586   fsal_status_t st;
05587   int rc;
05588     
05589   cmdfsal_thr_info_t * context;
05590 
05591   /* is the fs initialized ? */
05592   if (!is_loaded){
05593     fprintf(output,"Error: filesystem not initialized\n");
05594     return -1;
05595   }
05596   
05597   
05598   /* initialize current thread */
05599     
05600   context = GetFSALCmdContext();
05601   
05602   if ( context->is_thread_ok != TRUE )
05603   { 
05604     int rc;
05605     rc = Init_Thread_Context( output, context, 0 );
05606     if (rc != 0) return rc;
05607   }
05608   
05609   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
05610   if (argc!=3){
05611     fprintf(output,help_handlecmp);
05612     return -1;
05613   }
05614   
05615   strncpy(glob_path1,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05616   strncpy(glob_path2,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
05617   
05618   if (rc = 
05619       solvepath(glob_path1,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
05620                 argv[1],context->current_dir,&hdl1,output))
05621     return rc;
05622 
05623   if (rc = 
05624       solvepath(glob_path2,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
05625                 argv[2],context->current_dir,&hdl2,output))
05626     return rc;
05627   
05628   /* it should return :
05629    *  - 0 if handle are the same
05630    *    - A non null value else.
05631    */
05632   rc = FSAL_handlecmp( &hdl1, &hdl2, &st );
05633   
05634   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st )){    
05635     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_handlecmp:");
05636     print_fsal_status(output,st);
05637     fprintf(output,"\n");
05638     return st.major;    
05639   }
05640   
05641   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&hdl1);  
05642   fprintf(output, "%s: handle = @%s\n", argv[1],buff);
05643   
05644   snprintHandle(buff,2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)+1,&hdl2);  
05645   fprintf(output, "%s: handle = @%s\n", argv[2],buff);
05646   
05647   if ( rc == 0 )
05648   {
05649     fprintf(output, "Handles are identical.\n");
05650     return rc;
05651   }
05652   else
05653   {
05654     fprintf(output, "Handles are different.\n");
05655     return rc;
05656   }
05657   
05658   return 0; 
05659 }
